title: Data Analyst
description: At Precise Solutions, we are looking for top talent consultants to bring on as employees of our organization and service our clients in the various Life Sciences Industries. We are much more than a consulting firm! Precise Solutions provides competitive compensation packages with great salaries, benefits, health insurance, paid time off and employer-based 401k contributions.<br><br><strong><u>We Currently Have An Immediate Need For The Following<br><br></u></strong>Job Title: Data Analyst<br><br>Location: Lake County, IL USA<br><br>Compensation: $54.00 per hour, Paid Time off, Company 401k contributions, Health, dental, and vision insurance. Total Annual Compensation including benefits is $125,000.00<br><br>Resume Requirements<br><br>The following resume requirements must be met for resume to be considered<br><ul><li>Candidates first and last name (legal spelling) must be at the top of the resume </li><li>Valid email address must be at the top of the resume. LinkedIn links will not be accepted it must be a valid email address so our recruiters can respond to your resume </li><li>Please refrain from submitting resumes with candidates photo they will not be considered<br></li></ul><strong><u>Data Analyst Job Description<br><br></u></strong>The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for data modeling, Power BI dashboard creation and maintenance, ETL automation, ad-hoc reporting, and long term analytical and statistical projects. The Business Data Analyst will support cross-functional stakeholders and work with multiple sources and a wide range of data technologies and systems (e.g. SQL, Power BI, Hive, etc..)<br><br>Data Analyst Years of Experience/education and/or certifcations required <ul><li>BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance </li><li>5+yrs most recent experience as a Data Analyst </li><li>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing </li><li>3+ yrs Experience with Power BI </li><li>Experience creating PowerPoints and Dashboards for leadership<br></li></ul>Data Analyst Primary Duties and Responsibilities <ul><li>Creating and maintaining data dictionaries, use cases, functional and non-functional requirements documents, test plans and other project documents </li><li>Assisting with requirements facilitation and KPI definition/alignment </li><li>Assisting with user acceptance testing </li><li>Assisting with dashboard demos and feedback gathering </li><li>Think strategically and analytically about business and technical challenges, with the ability to work cross functionally </li><li>Ability to distill problem definitions, models, and constraints from informal business requirements </li><li>Demonstrate deep understanding of source data from various internal/external systems </li><li>Support key business systems and applications </li><li>Further establish the newly implemented change management process </li><li>Communicate and present findings to stakeholders </li><li>Work in an ambiguous environment, drawing out and developing business requirements to meet changing needs </li><li>Working with technical teams to capture data driven metrics<br></li></ul>Data Analyst Qualifications <ul><li>BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, or relevant work experience </li><li>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing </li><li>Advanced experience in Power BI </li><li>Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or other similar BI tools </li><li>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with development of metrics and business analytics, and have the aptitude to incorporate new approaches and methodologies, and a strong understanding of Data Warehouse (DW) concepts, while dealing with ambiguity </li><li>Excellent business and communication skills are a must to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions </li><li>Should be able to work cohesively with stakeholders to understand business requirements and implement reporting solutions<br></li></ul>Data Analyst Top Skills REQUIRED: <ul><li>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing </li><li>3+ yrs Experience with Power BI </li><li>Demonstrate deep understanding of source data from various internal/external systems. </li><li>Communicate and present findings to stakeholders </li><li>Excellent business and communication skills are a must to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions </li><li>Experience creating PowerPoints and Dashboards for leadership </li><li>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with development of metrics and business analytics, and have the aptitude to incorporate new approaches and methodologies, and a strong understanding of Data Warehouse (DW) concepts, while dealing with ambiguity </li><li>Should be able to work cohesively with stakeholders to understand business requirements and implement reporting solutions<br></li></ul>Data Analyst Nice To Have Skills <ul><li>Experience using HIVE <br></li></ul>Powered by JazzHR

title: Reporting/Data Analyst
description: <u><strong>Pay: $40-45/hour W2; C2C not possible for this role. </strong></u><p><br></p><strong><em>This role is expected to be on site initially. Once the skills and capability have been established, then limited remote working options can be considered.</em></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>The primary role will be to learn and develop tools to support the routine business processes and recommend solutions to support the business. This role will be used to produce and post routine reports and then automate the report generation.<p><br></p>This position is to support the BI reports and visualizations for the existing Global Supply Chain Business System organization through the development of database tools for the organizations we support.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have the ability to use critical thinking to develop available data into tools that best support the business needs.<p><br></p><strong><em>The candidate for this position should have the following skill sets:</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Proficient in Cognos Report Development. </li><li>Working knowledge of SQL</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>These additional skills would be helpful in working with the existing subject matter experts in the development and execution of business tools or processes<p><br></p><ul><li>PowerBI reporting and dashboard development</li><li>Relational Database Development Experience</li><li>Microsoft Office Tools</li></ul>

title: Asset Verification Data Analyst - Remote | WFH
description: If you are a SOC Analyst with experience, please read on!<br><br>Job requirements: Strong Security Background<br><br>Job Location: Tampa or Chicago hybrid, 3 days a week in office!<br><br>Job Title: SOC Security Analyst<br><br>We are a cutting edge fintech organization that is making the purchase, sell and transfer of cryptocurrencies available for everyone! We are extremely stable as we have been in business for 5+ years and have a valuation well over a billion dollars. This is the opportunity to get into a mid sized company while it is still early enough to make an impact! If you have ever wanted to work at the forefront of blockchain with the latest in technology. This is the role for you!<br><br>Top Reasons to Work with Us<br><br>Strong Compensation Package. Base + Bonus + RSU's<br><br>RSU's in a company that matters! We are valued at over a billion dollars and looking to IPO in the next 3-5 years. You are going to want a piece of that!<br><br>Great Company Benefits! Unlimited PTO, 401k ( w/ match), medical, vision, dental.<br><br>Incredible company culture! Everyone who works here loves working here.<br><br>Great leadership team. Our CEO is featured on multiple prestigious lists.<br><br>Voted onto Inc 5000 nation's fastest growing company lists.<br><br>What You Will Be Doing<br><br>Maintain the security of data and systems!<br><br>Be responsible for Security Event monitoring activities.<br><br>Stay up to date with new threats.<br><br>Help our security team hunt and identify security issues generated from the network.<br><br>What You Need for this Position<br><br>Strong experience as a SOC Analyst!<br><br>So, if you are a SOC Analyst with experience, please apply today!<br><br>Colorado employees will receive paid sick leave. For additional information about available benefits, please contact Keith Ellis<br><br><strong><u>Email Your Resume In Word To<br><br></u></strong>Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:<br><br>Keith.Ellis@CyberCoders.com<br><ul><li>Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : KE2-1725953L066 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***<br></li></ul>Keith Ellis - Recruiting Manager - CyberCoders<br><br>Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.<br><br><strong>CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer<br><br></strong>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br><strong>Your Right to Work</strong> – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.<br><br>

title: SOC Analyst
description: <strong>Opportunity<br><br></strong>Media.Monks is looking for an experienced <strong>Google Analytics Data Specialist</strong> with enterprise-level client facing experience in analytics and implementation of marketing and e-commerce projects. This experience should include helping clients to develop data strategies, complex measurement projects, and experience driving value with expert knowledge and client relationship skills.<br><br>You will be responsible for analytics initiatives, including managing relationships with a number of enterprise clients, building out their analytics framework, overseeing tagging, and ad-hoc reporting needs.<br><br>The ideal candidate <strong>MUST</strong> have a history of working with <strong>Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, </strong>and the <strong>Google Marketing Platform</strong> to help a variety of businesses, overseeing or directly having a hand in the implementation of their data collection, as well as finding ways to utilize this data to drive value for their clients through reporting and analysis.<br><br>This role also offers a huge opportunity for growth within our North America and global data team, the ability to participate in innovation on projects, and the potential to advance the practice of analytics and data from the forefront.<br><br><strong>The Role <br><br></strong><strong>Responsibilities Will Include<br><br></strong><ul><li>Provide subject matter expertise in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager to your clients via scheduled reports, ad-hoc reports, overseeing the tagging and analytics framework, and a variety of analysis and insight initiatives.</li><li>Develop analytics and data strategies for some of the largest brands in the world with a focus on measurably lifting their business. </li><li>Share your data and marketing analytics expertise with your clients and the MightyHive team; acting as a thought leader for your client, and an active participant in the knowledge growth of the MightyHive team.</li><li>Manage the relationship and projects for enterprise clients</li><li>Assist clients in understanding the importance of online measurement, and provide best practice guidelines for their general data strategy, as well as specific technical implementations.</li><li>Assist the data team in propelling our practice forward with new go to market initiatives and solutions.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Are Looking For<br><br></strong>We are looking for candidates that can wear two hats comfortably - “business” and “data” - with at least 2-3 years of client facing experience with Google Analytics. Ideally, this experience is with a digital marketing consulting firm, agency, or advertiser.<br><br>Beyond the experience with Google Analytics, in our eyes the most important qualities are intellectual curiosity, autonomy, and proactivity.<br><br><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience<br><br></strong><ul><li>You have deep knowledge and experience using Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and other parts of the Google Marketing Platform. </li><li>You have a deep knowledge and understanding of the data, adtech, and martech industry.</li><li>You have experience managing strategic projects and/or clients.</li><li>You’re someone who can sit in a room/Zoom with large clients and confidently establish yourself as a business partner while providing guidance on their analytics and data strategy.</li><li>You lean into a challenge; resilient and are a practitioner of accountability.</li><li>You are a self-directed, resourceful, and a critical thinker with attention-to-detail and problem-solving skills.</li><li>You are someone who loves to collaborate within cross-functional teams.</li><li>You have self and situational awareness; an ability to ‘read the room’; a leader and a listener.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred<br><br></strong><ul><li>You have experience implementing, and utilizing the data from a variety of other digital analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics, Optimize 360, etc. </li><li>You have experience with BI/Data analysis tools (Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.).</li><li>Familiarity with cloud data (GCP / BigQuery, AWS, etc) and how to leverage it is a big plus.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li>Career growth in a disruptor space &amp; entrepreneurial opportunity within the Media.Monks network </li><li>A globally diverse &amp; inclusive culture</li><li>Remote working environment</li><li>Flexible time off + 15 paid holidays</li><li>Company contribution (3%) to 401k, regardless of employee contribution</li><li>Company paid medical, dental, and vision insurance with additional niche benefits</li><li>Base Salary Band: $80,000 - $120,000<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Media.Monks<br><br></strong>Media.Monks is on a mission to create a new future for this industry. Our vision? Build everything with a belief that changing for good comes from changing who does the work. Yep, that means you. Welcome to the party—one global, cross-cultural collective with a passion for using our skills to create better and a better world. That’s how we’re able to connect the dots between data, content, digital media, and technology from everywhere we are—a true end-to-end model. Joining the Media.Monks collective means having the opportunity to create award-winning work with some of the most gifted, focused, joyful, talents from all over the world.<br><br>At Media.Monks, you’ll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to win the decade by changing the industry for good. Partner to 8 of the 10 most innovative companies in the world, Media.Monks works with established as well as up-and-coming global, regional, DTC and B2B brands, helping them own their data and build out customer ecosystems to elicit smart, efficient, high-impact engines for growth. We deliver table stakes quickly, creating cost efficiencies from day one to push up the creative effectiveness of our work with every cycle.<br><br>We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.<br><br>

title: Google Analytics Data Specialist
description: <strong>Cook County </strong><strong>Offices <br><br></strong><strong>Under The President<br><br></strong><strong>Administrative Hearings<br><br></strong><strong>Auditor<br><br></strong><strong>Bureau of Administration<br><br></strong><strong>Bureau of Economic Development<br><br></strong><strong>Bureau of Finance<br><br></strong><strong>Bureau of Human Resources<br><br></strong><strong>Bureau of Technology<br><br></strong><strong>Facilities<br><br></strong><strong>Office of the President <br><br></strong><strong>Job Summary<br><br></strong>Under the direction of the Data Privacy Officer (DPO) or designee, implements and supports the development of County privacy policies, procedures, and operations to ensure privacy requirements and regulations for the protection of personal information. Conducts analysis and creation of strategies for privacy program improvement. Provides training and educational materials related to privacy protection and assists in mitigating risks related to the unauthorized access of sensitive information. Performs privacy risk assessments, privacy impact assessments and other related documentation. In collaboration with the Security Operations Center (SOC), provides management with reports detailing alerts and warnings of potential risks, threats and vulnerabilities to critical data. Performs other duties as assigned.<br><br><strong>This position is Actively Recruited and At Will.<br><br></strong><strong>Minimum Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Possession of a High School diploma or General Education Development (GED) certificate is required.</li><li>Three (3) years of full-time work experience as an analyst in Information Technology (IT), Risk Management, Audit or Information Security is required.</li><li>A certification in Information Security, Audit or Risk Management is required.<br><br></li></ul><strong>OR<br></strong><ul><li>Graduation from an accredited college or university with an associate degree is required.</li><li>One (1) years of full-time work experience as an analyst in Information Technology (IT), Risk Management, Audit, or Information Security is required.</li><li>A certification in Information Security, Audit or Risk Management is required.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Information Security Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or Technology System.</li><li>International Association of Privacy Professional certifications such as Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP): Certified Information Privacy Management (CIPM); title: DATA PRIVACY SPECIALIST (BUREAU OF TECHNOLOGY) - ACTIVELY RECRUITED
description: Podium exists to help local businesses win. Using Podium, local businesses can simplify the way they communicate with their customers—from collecting payments to facilitating online reviews to launching marketing campaigns, and much more.<p><br></p>Our work and focus on helping local businesses thrive has been recognized across the industry, including Forbes’ Next Billion Dollar Startups, Forbes’ Cloud 100, the Inc. 5000, and Fast Company’s World’s Most Innovative Companies.<p><br></p>We look for people who are curious, creative and are willing to do the work to be a little better every day. We also embody our company values in all that we do, which always starts with being Customer Obsessed, followed by Be a Founder, Zero Drama, and Enjoy the Ride. Does that sound like you?<p><br></p>As a Junior Salesforce Developer at Podium, you will participate in the optimization of our internal systems and operations around Salesforce.com. You will be a critical part of refining Podium’s growing business by providing scalable data storage methods and code. If you are someone who is passionate about building a business, creative problem-solving and you thrive in a fast-paced, open environment, then this is the right role for you! We are looking for someone who is a self-starter and open to learning best practice development from the team. This role comes with the opportunity to absorb knowledge and grow as a developer.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participate in building the Podium Business Applications Department</li><li>Help maintain and improve development and deployment processes</li><li>Participate in code reviews</li><li>Develop on the Force.com platform using APEX, SOQL, and Lightning, Flows and other Declarative automations</li><li>Work with the service desk team to take bug reports, identify the issues, and fix or send them to the right team member to fix</li><li>Engage with peers and stakeholders to identify technical debt in your area of responsibility and recommend and prioritize long term solutions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Should Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Salesforce Automations</li><li>Some background in CRM and ERP technologies</li><li>Passion for delivering valuable, meaningful and data-driven solutions</li><li>Proficient ability to understand and use code versioning tools such as Gitlab</li><li>Ability to understand and adapt to rapidly changing priorities in a high-growth environment</li><li>Strong collaboration and problem-solving skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Hope You Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Development experience is a bonus, but not necessary</li><li>Salesforce Platform Developer 1 or Salesforce Admin Certifications</li><li>Experience using Salesforce DX </li><li>Experience with Salesforce CPQ/Billing</li><li>Experience working with Zuora and/or Netsuite</li><li>Experience with API Integrations</li><li>Experience with Gearset or other CI/CD tools</li><li>Experience with Jira or other ticket management tools</li><li>Experience with, or knowledge of, Agile project management</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Open and transparent culture - Checkout this video to see what it’s like to work at Podium </li><li>Life insurance, long and short-term disability coverage</li><li>Paid maternity and paternity leave</li><li>Fertility Benefits</li><li>Generous vacation time, plus three 4-day summer holiday weekends</li><li>Excellent medical, dental, and vision benefits</li><li>401k Plan</li><li>Bi-annual swag drops with cool Podium gear and apparel </li><li>A stellar HQ (Utah) gym with local professional coaches and classes offered</li><li>Onsite HQ (Utah) child care center, subsidized for employees</li><li>Additional benefits for fully remote employees</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Podium is an equal opportunity employer. Podium provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, genetic information, marital status or veteran status.</em>

title: Business Systems Analyst
description: <strong>Title: Cognos Reporting / Business Systems Analyst<br> Duration: Through end of 2023 to start<br> Location: Des Plaines, IL 60018<br></strong> <br> This position is to support the BI reports and visualizations for the existing Global Supply Chain Business System organization through the development of database tools for the organizations we support.<br> <br> The ideal candidate will have the ability to use critical thinking to develop available data into tools that best support the business needs.<br> <br> The candidate for this position should have the following skill sets:<br> <br> 1. Cognos Report Development (ability to write code to build reports directly or through Cognos)<br> 2. SQL Query Development experience<br> <br> These additional skills would be helpful in working with the existing subject matter experts in the development and execution of business tools or processes:<br> <br> 1. Proficient in Power BI Dashboarding and Report Development, including DAX development<br> 2. Relational Database Development Experience<br> 3. Microsoft Office Tools<br> <br> The primary role will be to learn and develop tools to support the routine business processes and recommend solutions to support the business. This role will be used to produce and post routine reports and then automate the report generation.<br> <br> This role is full time and is expected to be on site initially. Once the skills and capability have been established, then limited remote working options can be considered.

title: Junior Salesforce Developer
description: <strong>Position Overview:<br><br></strong>As an entry level Programmatic Campaign Analyst, you will be introduced to the execution of programmatic campaigns utilizing our proprietary technology platform. The role involves a combination of data analysis, creative problem-solving, and cross-team collaboration to ensure campaign success and client satisfaction. It is expected that through our training program and hands-on experience that a Programmatic Campaign Associate will demonstrate the potential to become a Yield Manager at AdTheorent. As part of the Yield team, your official title will be Yield Analyst.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities Include:<br></strong><ul><li>Learn and develop skills for management of campaign performance, campaign delivery, and campaign profitability.</li><li>Apply data analysis to execute advertising campaigns based on client objectives.</li><li>Develop actionable insights and make recommendations to internal Client Services team.</li><li>Monitor and analyze reporting on a frequent basis to ensure optimal delivery and performance of campaigns</li><li>Work with Data Science team to improve performance for campaigns.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>College degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Business.</li><li>Excellent time management and creative problem solving skills.</li><li>Can thrive in a fast-paced and high-growth work environment.</li><li>Ability to translate business concepts to online marketing strategies, and vice versa.</li><li>Team player with good communication and collaboration skills.</li><li>Fluent in Excel.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong>We offer full health coverage, generous PTO, an award-winning office culture!<br><br>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to foster community, inclusion and diversity within the organization. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of racial, religious, sexual or gender identity, to apply.<br><br>

title: Business Systems Analyst
description: <strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating, and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build, and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com.<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant’s QEA Practice<br><br></u></strong>We are the largest Quality Assurance Practice Globally servicing 800+ Clients including 50+ clients in Fortune 100. We bring the industry leading vision and expertise to help with Quality Engineering transformation journey for our reputed clients. We provide Next Gen QA offerings like System Modernization assurance, Business Process Assurance, Quality Engineering, Cloud Platform Assurance, Customer Experience Assurance and Robotic Test Automation. We have been ranked #1 for Market Impact by Everest Group for four times in a row and ranked #1 for completeness of vision, test advisory and Digital Business Assurance in Gartner Magic Quadrant.<br><ul><li>Strong knowledge in Finacle L1/L2 support , Finacle scripting, Unix, Finacle Development and customization knowledge ,understanding of EOD/BOD process ,Knowledge on Finacle Batches,</li><li>Familiar with Finacle versions 10.x , 11.x </li><li>Identifying, Tracking and Reviewing deliverables,</li><li>Create detailed design document/technical specifications, for select projects.</li><li>Create efficient and quality code based on given specifications.</li><li>Follow product standards, quality assurance norms and guidelines.</li><li>Conduct peer reviews during coding and testing.</li><li>Log peer review defects in the appropriate tool.</li><li>Provide support to the Senior Product Specialist in defect analysis and resolution.</li><li>Participate in deployment activities like reviewing all deliverables as per the delivery checklist, preparing/reviewing deployment document and mock testing all deliverables.</li><li>Develop reusable components. </li><li>Minimum of 5+ years of finacle development experience need<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:<br><ul><li>Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance</li><li>Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) plan and contributions</li><li>Long-term/Short-term Disability</li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan<br></li></ul><strong>Disclaimer: </strong>The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. title: Programmatic Campaign Analyst - Chicago
description: Our Client, a premiere manufacturer of motion control and drive systems that set the worldwide benchmark in machine building and driver technology seeks a Applications Engineer to join it’s team due to phenomenal growth. This is a great time to join this group as the industry segments they serve are red hot, leading for mid-term growth projections to double.<p><br></p>In this role you will be working with customers in the selection and application of motion control equipment including items servo motors, gear heads, gear boxes, and other electro-mechanical and mechatronics systems. Not only are my client company’s products world classes, but you will be working on some really cool and intriguing projects within forward thinking companies. You will be working on highly visible projects with customers where you will analyze customer needs, then develop and write formal technical specifications, performance requirements and proposals for application and integration of products for customer applications.<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor degree in Engineering with a specialization in Mechanical or Electrical</li><li> 2+ years’ experience in working with electro-mechanical devices and/ or servo motors, drives, gear boxes, mechatronic systems.</li></ul><p><br></p>To confidentially learn more about this interesting opportunity and to network with our experienced team about similar opportunities apply today!

title: Data Delivery & Visualization Engineer
description: Application Developer - Chicago<br><br><strong><u>Company Description<br><br></u></strong>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<br><br>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation that prioritizes a highly collaborative culture. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<br><br>The diverse and passionate teams within RedMane address complex, real world challenges. Technology is just our tool.<br><br>The Role<br><br>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for an application developer as we continue to grow our Chicago based practice. The application developer will perform development for our no code / low code, highly configurable SaaS product. This product incorporates leading-edge technologies, from cloud-based mobility to data visualizations and artificial intelligence. The developer will work on a dynamic development team in an Agile/Scrum environment to deliver a customized solution for our clients.<br><br><strong><u>Skills &amp; Role Requirements<br><br></u></strong>The Application Developer will need to have:<br><ul><li>3- B years of experience in software development, preferably in a C- 3, JavaScript, .NET, and SQL Server environment. </li><li>1- B years of experience with Node.js, GoJs, Angular, or similar technologies. </li><li>Bachelor'2019s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other field. </li><li>Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills. </li><li>Highly self-motivated with the ability to work independently. </li><li>Proven ability to efficiently learn and apply new ideas and concepts. </li><li>Ability to organize time, staff, and projects efficiently.<br></li></ul>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these qualities: <ul><li>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values. </li><li>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.<br></li></ul>We Offer You<br><br>RedMane has an environment that offers challenging and interesting work. A place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm. Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<br><br>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen. RedMane is very proud to offer employees professional and personal perks that include:<ul><li>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week.</li><li>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.</li><li>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring.</li><li>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5k- 7s to triathlons.</li><li>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.</li></ul>

title: Applications Engineer
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>The team is responsible for the process, controls, and tools that support API development, security, publishing, consumption, and monitoring.<br><br>Competent to perform all programming, project management, and development assignments without close supervision; normally assigned the more complex aspects of systems work.<br><br>Works directly on complex application/technical problem identification and resolution, including responding to off-shift and weekend support calls.<br><br>Works independently on complex systems or infrastructure components that may be used by one or more applications or systems.<br><br>Drives application development focused around delivering business valuable features<br><br>Maintains high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits<br><br>Identifies and encourage areas for growth and improvement within the team<br><br>Guide the team to develop a structured application/interface code, new program documentation, operations documentation, and user guides in a casual, flexible environment. Communicate with end-users and internal customers to help direct the development, debugging, and testing of application software for accuracy, integrity, interoperability, and completeness.<br><br>Performs integrated testing and customer acceptance testing of components that requires careful planning and execution to ensure timely, quality results<br><br><strong><u>Typical Task Breakdown<br></u></strong><ul><li> Work within API Management team, hands-on APIGEE Edge, OAS Spec review, Proxy development</li><li> Reviewing OAS /Swaggers - Operational</li><li> Developing Proxies on APIGEE</li><li> Developing Automations</li><li> Rotational weekly On Call Support /Incident Management using Service Now.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Technical Skills<br><br></u></strong>Experience writing API proxies on platforms such as Apigee Edge<br><br>Hands on experience with API tools such as Swagger Editor &amp; Postman, and linting tools like Spectral.<br><br>Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth 2.0 and TLS.<br><br>Scripting JavaScript, Python, or similar tools<br><br>Required Skills : Technical Skills Experience writing API proxies on Apigee Edge Hands on experience with API tools such as Swagger Editor &amp; Postman, and linting tools like Spectral. Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth 2.0 and TLS. Scripting JavaScript, Python, or similar tools<br><br><strong><u>Basic Qualification<br><br></u></strong><strong>Additional Skills : <br><br></strong>Background Check :Yes<br><br><strong><u>Notes<br><br></u></strong>Selling points for candidate :<br><br><strong><u>Project Verification Info<br><br></u></strong>Candidate must be your W2 Employee :Yes<br><br>Exclusive to Apex :No<br><br>Face to face interview required :No<br><br>Candidate must be local :No<br><br>Candidate must be authorized to work without sponsorship ::No<br><br>Interview times set : :No<br><br>Type of project :Other Project Type<br><br>Master Job Title :Misc: Non-Technical<br><br>Branch Code :Bloomington

title: Application Developer - D Chicago
description: Software Developer (Part-Time)<br>Are you a student who is interested in finance and investing? Do you have the skills and creativity to develop software solutions that can help investors make better decisions? If yes, then we have an exciting opportunity for you!<br>GrowthSphere LLC is a value investment firm that aims to achieve superior long-term returns for its members and investors. We invest in publicly traded companies, private businesses, and real estate assets with strong fundamentals and long-term growth potential. We are looking for a part-time software developer who can help us with various projects involving data analysis, web development, app development, and more.<br>As a software developer at GrowthSphere LLC, you will:<br>Work on various software development projects using different technologies and frameworks<br>Collaborate with other developers, analysts, and investment professionals to deliver high-quality products<br>Test and debug your code to ensure functionality and performance<br>Learn new skills and tools to enhance your professional growth<br>Contribute to the improvement of our processes and standards<br>To be eligible for this position, you should:<br>Be a student enrolled in a computer science, engineering, or related field<br>Have experience in web development using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP<br>Have knowledge of databases, APIs, and web services<br>Have familiarity with Git or other version control systems<br>Have excellent communication and problem-solving skills<br>Have a keen interest in finance and investing<br>If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding part-time job that can help you learn more about the world of investing, then apply now!

title: Toshiba Developer
description: <p>We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.<br><br><br></p><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.</li><li>Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.</li><li>Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other.</li></ul><p><br><br></p><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool process:<br><br></strong></p><p>Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.<br><br></p><p><br><br></p><p><strong>About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)<br><br></strong></p><p>Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfillment at work, and help build and scale high performing teams.<br><br><br></p><p>Keep in mind, joining our talent pool does not guarantee a job offer. We aim to balance your technical skills with the results of your F4S work style assessment to match the hiring needs of our partners.<br><br></p><p><br>Your feedback is a gift! Write to us via: hello@f4s.com to help co-create the future of recruitment, together.<br><br></p>
description_json: <p>We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.<br><br><br></p><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.</li><li>Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.</li><li>Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other.</li></ul><p><br><br></p><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool process:<br><br></strong></p><p>Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.<br><br></p><p><br><br></p><p><strong>About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)<br><br></strong></p><p>Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfillment at work, and help build and scale high performing teams.<br><br><br></p><p>Keep in mind, joining our talent pool does not guarantee a job offer. We aim to balance your technical skills with the results of your F4S work style assessment to match the hiring needs of our partners.<br><br></p><p><br>Your feedback is a gift! Write to us via: hello@f4s.com to help co-create the future of recruitment, together.<br><br></p>

title: API Developer
description: <strong>Identity &amp; Access Management Developer</strong><strong>Remote    </strong><strong>6+ Months Contract</strong> Experience Required:<ul><li>3-5 years of advanced experience in all aspects of Active Directory Architecture and Administration (Schema, Replication, DNS, Permissions flow, Trust Management, Group Policy Management, Backup/Recovery, Security)</li><li>3-5 years of general Windows Server administration</li><li>2 years administering Azure Active Directory</li><li>PowerShell or equivalent scripting experience (python / C#)</li></ul> <br><strong>Preferred:</strong><ul><li>LDAP Administration experience (example: ODSEE/OpenLDAP/OpenDJ/etc.)</li><li>Working knowledge of Azure Active Directory Connect and administering Microsoft 365</li><li>Previous experience with Privileged Access Management</li><li>Previous experience in Identity &amp; Access Management</li><li>Familiarity with Okta</li><li>Familiarity with SQL and ability to write simple queries.</li><li>Familiarity with using the Linux Operating System</li><li>Working knowledge of Firewalls and troubleshooting firewall and network issues</li><li>Working knowledge of 3rd party and Microsoft CA certificate management</li><li>Previous experience mentoring junior resources.</li></ul> <br><strong>Job Competencies:<br></strong>Required:<ul><li>Professional and effective written and oral communication skills</li><li>Ability to use analytical and quantitative skills and diagnostic techniques to resolve problems.</li><li>Ability to manage complex technical details.</li><li>Familiarity with project management and business analyst processes and methodology</li><li>Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical staff.</li><li>Ability to effectively converse with, and listen to, all levels of users to understand their environment and the impact of system changes.</li><li>Sensitivity to the cultural requirements on a campus for collegial and participative interactions.</li><li>Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.</li><li>Confidentiality related to sensitive University matters such as strategic initiatives, trade secrets, quiet periods, and scientific discoveries yet to be put in the public domain.</li><li>Confidentiality related to personal information access.</li></ul> <br><strong>Responsibilities:<br></strong> <br>   <br>      <br>• 70%<ul><li>Leads architectural discussion and implementation of directory services.</li><li>Provides tier two ticket support for all IAM services.</li><li>Provides tier one and tier two ticket support for the Directory.</li><li>Creates documentation (knowledge base articles) for IAM services.</li><li>Creates short instructional videos for IAM services.</li><li>Trains and mentor’s student Support Analysts</li><li>Helps to keep recurring projects, such as the Directory Reviewer Refresh, on track and current.</li></ul> <br>• 25%<ul><li>Works with the University divisions and departments to gather requirements for projects and updates to current services.</li><li>Develops requirements and feedback into documentation that can be used to further IAM development of new services or refinement of current services.</li></ul>• 5%<ul><li>Other duties as assigned.</li></ul>

title: Software Engineer
description: <em>Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.</em><p><br></p><strong><u>Roles And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>OKTA Identity Engine and Classic Engine</li><li>Gather requirements around B2B &amp; B2C use cases and design the user journeys.</li><li>Implementing OKTA B2B/B2C/B2E user Sign Up journeys Self Service Sign Up, Entitlement Management, Social Sign Up and Invitation Redemption</li><li>Integration with applications using SAML 2.0 / OIDC and Http Header Injection.</li><li>Configuring enrollment and conditional access policies for MFA</li><li>Experience in development/configuration of standard/custom IAM integrations using Java, .Net, or other major scripting languages</li><li>Designing and implementing custom authentication and authorization flows</li><li>Analyzing, evaluating and synthesizing solutions.</li><li>Have extensive knowledge and experience scoping and implementing complex OKTA integrations involving multi-forest and multi-domain environments, advanced single sign-on (SSO), and inbound federation.</li><li>Have extensive knowledge about how OKTA enables advanced User Lifecycle Management scenarios involving mobile devices, security policy frameworks, supported SSO options, and advanced directory integration for cloud and on-premise access</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ overall years of experience as part of IT projects</li><li>3+ years hands on experience in OKTA B2C and B2B</li><li>Knowledge of NodeJS / Angular JS/javascript is required</li><li>Hands on experience in working with Restful Services. Hands on experience in OKTA Workflow. Hands on experience in implementation, development and administration with OKTA</li><li>Experience in scripting and programming languages like JavaScript, BASH, Java etc.</li><li>Good knowledge of Web/application servers (IIS, WebSphere, WebLogic, JBoss, and Apache)</li><li>In-depth understanding of SAML, OIDC &amp; OAuth protocols.</li><li>Integration knowledge of HTTP Header Injection for legacy applications</li></ul>

description: <ul><li>Job Family: Development and Engineering</li><li>Type: Full time</li><li>Date Posted:Apr 12, 2023</li><li>Req #: JR54325<br></li></ul><strong>Location:<br></strong><ul><li>IL, CHICAGO<br></li></ul><strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Job Title:</strong> <strong>Engineer III<br><br></strong><strong>Location:</strong> <strong>Hybrid (Considering applicants throughout the US)<br><br></strong><strong>Responsible for the delivery of end to end system development and maintenance on complex technology systems within assigned client group, business unit or corporate department.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Primary Duties May Include, But Are Not Limited To<br><br></u></strong><strong>Development on medium to large complex customer technology platforms or architectures.<br><br></strong><strong>Maintains active relationships with internal and/or external stakeholder to develop business requirements.<br><br></strong><strong>Analyzes and classifies complex change request and identifies and documents possible system code enhancements.<br><br></strong><strong>Demonstrates knowledge of industry trends, our products and infrastructure.<br><br></strong><strong>Collaborates with engineers and graphic designers, analyzes and classifies complex change request and reviews and evaluates possible enhancements.<br><br></strong><strong>Works with development team to develop and define application scope and objectives and prepare functional and/or technical specifications.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Analyzes And Evaluates Detailed Business And Technical Requirements.<br><br></u></strong><strong>Understands the product and analytics and drive requirements that take into account stakeholders needs.<br><br></strong><strong>Identifies problems/risks.<br><br></strong><strong>Codes and maintains complex components of information systems.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Mentors Others On Coding Standards And Performs Code Reviews.<br><br></u></strong><strong>Reviews test cases and advises QA on adjacent code/regression impact.<br><br></strong><strong>Develops and performs system testing and fixes defects identified during testing and re-executes unit tests to validate results.<br><br></strong><strong>Aids in integrating activities with other IT departments for successful implementation and support of project efforts.<br><br></strong><strong>Provides on call support and monitors the system and identifies system deficiencies.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong>Requires an BA/BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field of study and a minimum of 3 years experience on one platform, multi database, multi language or multi business application; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong>Experience mentoring others, leading small projects and providing troubleshooting support is strongly preferred.<br><br></strong><strong>Knowledge of RDBMS SQL required, T/SQL (Microsoft or Sybase) preferred.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Exposure To ETL Tool (SSIS, Data Stage, Informatica) Preferred<br><br></u></strong><strong>Exposure to UNIX / LINUX preferred.<br><br></strong><strong>Knowledge of scripting language as a bonus.<br><br></strong><strong>If this job is assigned to any Government Business Division entity, the applicant and incumbent fall under a 'sensitive position' work designation and may be subject to additional requirements beyond those associates outside Government Business Divisions. Requirements include but are not limited to more stringent and frequent background checks and/or government clearances, segregation of duties principles, role specific training, monitoring of daily job functions, and sensitive data handling instructions. Associates in these jobs must follow the specific policies, procedures, guidelines, etc. as stated by the Government Business Division in which they are employed.<br><br></strong>Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health. Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.<br><br><strong>Be part of an Extraordinary Team<br><br></strong>Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?<br><br>We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.<br><br>The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide – and Elevance Health approves – a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.<br><br>Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact ability@icareerhelp.com for assistance.<br><br>EEO is the Law<br><br>Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran<br><br>Please use the links below to review statements of protection from discrimination under Federal law for job applicants and employees.<br><ul><li>EEO Policy Statement</li><li>Know Your Rights</li><li>Pay Transparency</li><li>Privacy Notice for California Residents<br></li></ul>Elevance Health, Inc. is anE-verify Employer (https://www.e-verify.gov/sites/default/files/everify/posters/EVerifyParticipationPoster.pdf)<br><br>Need Assistance?<br><br>Email us (elevancehealth@icareerhelp.com) or call 1-877-204-7664

title: Api Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>What You'll Do<p><br></p><ul><li>Work closely with management to execute analytical initiatives.</li><li>Solve business problems by leveraging techniques such as segmentation, optimization, advanced analytics and machine learning.</li><li>Create reports and dashboards to closely monitor performance metrics and provide insights.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How You'll Do It</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop advanced analytics solutions including customer segmentation, optimization, test &amp; design of experiments and prescriptive analytics to solve business problems. Operate as a subject matter expert on statistical analysis, test and design of experiment, analysis methodology, modeling &amp; application and financial impact analysis.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional partners to understand their business needs, formulated and completed end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations. Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of leadership, creating visual displays of quantitative information.</li><li>Establish and maintain effective performance tracking; identify improvement opportunity, form hypothesis, propose, design and implement tests to drive strategy enhancement and optimization.</li><li>Manage multiple priorities, communicate business performance and project progress to management &amp; business partners.</li><li>Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs. Facilitate implementation of work product and ensure accuracy.</li><li>Consistently follow standard work processes and documentation requirements. Recommend improvement to work processes to increase efficiency while maintaining quality of work. Continuously improve technical and leadership skills through training and development.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Basic Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Analytics, Engineering, Statistics or related field</li><li>2+ years of experience in Credit Risk, Fraud Risk, Marketing Analytics, Optimization, Operations Analytics, Modeling/Data Science or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Master’s Degree in Analytics, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field</li><li>Experience in Credit Risk, Fraud Risk, Marketing Analytics, Optimization, Operations Analytics, Modeling/Data Science or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $83,500.00 to $116,700.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Application Engineer
description: <strong>Position: </strong> Software Engineer<p><br></p><strong>Duration: </strong>6-12 months<p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong> Chicago, IL 60606 - hybrid onsite 3 days a week<p><br></p>I am looking for a Software Engineer with expertise in Java and Informatica to join a Data Platform Architecture team.<p><br></p>As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for fine-tuning the Service Layer of our software applications, ensuring their optimal performance and seamless integration. Your primary focus will be on utilizing Java and Informatica to enhance and optimize the service layer components of our systems.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop, enhance, and maintain the service layer components of our software applications using Java and Informatica.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and other developers, to understand requirements and design efficient solutions.</li><li>Fine-tune the service layer to improve performance, scalability, and reliability of our applications.</li><li>Identify and resolve bottlenecks, bugs, and performance issues in the service layer code.</li><li>Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards, best practices, and quality guidelines.</li><li>Work closely with database administrators and backend developers to integrate the service layer with backend systems and databases.</li><li>Implement and maintain integrations with external systems using Informatica.</li><li>Optimize data flows and transformations within the service layer to ensure efficient data processing and accurate results.</li><li>Stay updated with the latest industry trends, tools, and technologies related to Java, Informatica, and service layer development.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field. A relevant master’s degree is a plus.</li><li>Proven experience as a Software Engineer, with a focus on developing and fine-tuning the service layer using Java and Informatica.</li><li>Strong proficiency in Java programming language and related frameworks (e.g., Spring, Spring Boot framework, Hibernate). </li><li>Hands on experience in data pipeline development using modern ETL tools specifically on Informatica PowerCenter and/or Informatica IICS</li><li>Solid understanding of service-oriented architecture (SOA) concepts and RESTful web services.</li><li>Proficiency in SQL and Scripting (Unix shell and /or Python)</li><li>Familiarity with performance optimization techniques and tools for Java applications.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively within a team.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and their related services.</li><li>Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data analytics concepts.</li><li>Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).</li><li>Understanding of DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment. </li></ul><p><br></p><em>Did you know about Sterling? As a Sterling contract W2 employee you are become an owner in Sterling. We are an Employee-Owned ESOP (Employee Stock Option Program) Company that itself is an additional retirement benefit on top of our other exceptional Sterling benefits, including paid holidays, PTO, the ability to join the 401K with a company match. Sterling Engineering / Staffing could be your future home.</em><p><br></p><strong>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</strong><p><br></p><strong>#SP</strong>
description_json: <strong>Position: </strong> Software Engineer<p><br></p><strong>Duration: </strong>6-12 months<p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong> Chicago, IL 60606 - hybrid onsite 3 days a week<p><br></p>I am looking for a Software Engineer with expertise in Java and Informatica to join a Data Platform Architecture team.<p><br></p>As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for fine-tuning the Service Layer of our software applications, ensuring their optimal performance and seamless integration. Your primary focus will be on utilizing Java and Informatica to enhance and optimize the service layer components of our systems.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop, enhance, and maintain the service layer components of our software applications using Java and Informatica.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and other developers, to understand requirements and design efficient solutions.</li><li>Fine-tune the service layer to improve performance, scalability, and reliability of our applications.</li><li>Identify and resolve bottlenecks, bugs, and performance issues in the service layer code.</li><li>Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards, best practices, and quality guidelines.</li><li>Work closely with database administrators and backend developers to integrate the service layer with backend systems and databases.</li><li>Implement and maintain integrations with external systems using Informatica.</li><li>Optimize data flows and transformations within the service layer to ensure efficient data processing and accurate results.</li><li>Stay updated with the latest industry trends, tools, and technologies related to Java, Informatica, and service layer development.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field. A relevant master’s degree is a plus.</li><li>Proven experience as a Software Engineer, with a focus on developing and fine-tuning the service layer using Java and Informatica.</li><li>Strong proficiency in Java programming language and related frameworks (e.g., Spring, Spring Boot framework, Hibernate). </li><li>Hands on experience in data pipeline development using modern ETL tools specifically on Informatica PowerCenter and/or Informatica IICS</li><li>Solid understanding of service-oriented architecture (SOA) concepts and RESTful web services.</li><li>Proficiency in SQL and Scripting (Unix shell and /or Python)</li><li>Familiarity with performance optimization techniques and tools for Java applications.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively within a team.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and their related services.</li><li>Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data analytics concepts.</li><li>Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).</li><li>Understanding of DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment. </li></ul><p><br></p><em>Did you know about Sterling? As a Sterling contract W2 employee you are become an owner in Sterling. We are an Employee-Owned ESOP (Employee Stock Option Program) Company that itself is an additional retirement benefit on top of our other exceptional Sterling benefits, including paid holidays, PTO, the ability to join the 401K with a company match. Sterling Engineering / Staffing could be your future home.</em><p><br></p><strong>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</strong><p><br></p><strong>#SP</strong>

title: Application Engineer
description: Title: Digital Reliability Analyst Location: Prefer someone local to Chicago Duration: Long TermManager Comments :Prefer someone local to Chicago.Description:OverviewUnited’s Digital technology team is looking for an experienced Usability/Accessibility tester to join our Digital Reliability team. As an Accessibility Tester at United, you will work collaboratively with our Agile/Scrum teams responsible for testing our digital products for compliance with accessibility standards, such as WCAG 2.0. You will also be responsible for writing and maintaining accessibility testing documentation, such as test plans, test cases, and bug reports. The ideal candidate will have experience with a variety of accessibility testing tools and methodologies (e.g., VoiceOver, JAWS, Dragon Naturally Speaking, ZoomText, TalkBack, Speak to Me, axe DevTools), as well as a strong understanding of accessibility standards and how they apply to web, mobile, and software applications.Job Description:<p><br></p><ul><li>Understand and apply accessibility guidelines (WCAG, Section 508, ADA, AODA) to United Digital products</li><li>Perform manual (an or automated) testing of digital products for compliance with accessibility standards</li><li>Be able to describe accessibility issues and recommendations for resolving same in bug reports to developers</li><li>Retest products after fixes have been implemented to ensure that issues have been properly addressed</li><li>Knowledge of the latest accessibility technologies and trends</li><li>Educate team members on accessibility best practices</li><li>Advocate for the inclusion of accessibility considerations in all phases of product development</li><li>Participate in usability testing to provide insights on how people with accessibility challenges use United products</li><li>Assist with the creation of accessibility-related documentation, such as policies, procedures, and user guides</li><li>Provide training and awareness sessions on accessibility topics to internal and external audiences</li><li>Design and write manual front-end test scripts for assigned workflows to validate design and configuration against defined requirements</li><li>Analyze, resolve, and report on testing status, gaps, and issues to leadership during various testing cycles</li><li>Build collaborative relationships with internal and external project stakeholders to achieve business objectives related to testing activities, defect investigations, issues, and concerns related to assigned testing and products</li><li>Maintain testing documentation and artifacts for each test as proof of validation.Required Qualifications:Applicants for the Accessibility Tester role are required to have these qualifications:</li><li>Knowledge of digital accessibility and inclusion</li><li>Knowledge of regulations related to digital accessibility (e.g., Section 508, ADA, WCAG)</li><li>Experience using accessibility evaluation tools and frameworks</li><li>Experience using assistive technologies (e.g., VoiceOver, JAWS, Dragon Naturally Speaking, ZoomText, TalkBack, Speak to Me, axe DevTools)</li><li>5 + years of combined related work experience and completed higher educationand some level of Accessbility certificationPreferredApplicants with the following qualifications will be preferred:</li><li>Knowledge of web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript and ARIA)</li><li>Professional training in using assistive technologies</li><li>Experience conducting usability tests that include participants with accessibility challenges</li><li>Has experience using assistive technology working on products or similar products</li><li>Experience using automation tools Digital Reliability Analyst // Chicago, IL</li></ul>
