title: Engineer III-2
description: <ul><li>Job Family: Development and Engineering</li><li>Type: Full time</li><li>Date Posted:Apr 17, 2023</li><li>Req #: JR56408<br></li></ul><strong>Location:<br></strong><ul><li>IL, CHICAGO</li><li>National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint, National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint<br></li></ul><strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Job Title: Application Security Engineer III<br><br></strong><strong>Job Location: Chicago, IL (100% Remote)<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job Summary<br><br></u></strong>Responsible for managing the delivery of information and network security systems and/or technology services, which may include server, desktop, software, network, database, helpdesk components.<br><br><strong><u>Primary Duties Include But Are Not Limited To<br></u></strong><ul><li>Provides trouble resolution on complex problems and leads implementations for system and network security technologies</li><li>Develops testing plans to ensure quality of implementation</li><li>Coordinates and prepares the reporting of data security events and incidents</li><li>Provides system and network architecture support for information and network security technologies</li><li>Provides technical support to business and technology associates in risk assessments and implementation of appropriate information security procedures, standards and technologies</li><li>Represents major upgrades and reconfigurations in change control</li><li>Design &amp; analyze mix of vendor services meeting business and information security requirements</li><li>Maintains relationship with key vendors/strategic partners within organization</li><li>Determine and perform complex configuration changes to meet business and information security requirements</li><li>Perform capacity analysis</li><li>Recommend and implement capacity increases</li><li>Serve as the technical escalation for results of preventative maintenance routines</li><li>Supervise preventative maintenance</li><li>Represents infrastructure security support in significant projects and performs the most complex operations and administration tasks</li><li>Respond to level 3 &amp; 4 change and problem requests without supervision</li><li>Lead level 1 &amp; 2 incident recoveries and root cause analysis.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Requires a BA/BS degree in Information Technology and a minimum of 3 years experience in a support &amp; operations or design &amp; engineering role in any of the following areas: access management or network security technologies, servers, networks, network communications, application security, cyber security or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Technical security certifications (e.g. Systems Security Certified Practitioner) strongly preferred.</li><li>Experience using Static scan tools and Dynamic scan tools like Checkmarx, prisma or Qualys preferred.</li><li>Good experience and understanding of the security best practices in every step of software development lifecycle (SDLC) .</li><li>Experience adhering to secure coding principles and aid in coding/testing the application against security risks/parameters before release.</li><li>Coordination with various cross functional teams on remediating application security findings that comes out pen test, Qualys, Prisma etc.</li><li>Knowledge using app security scan tools and also a good understanding of remediation steps for this is preferred.</li><li>This individual will be responsible for enabling and recommending developers on possible remediation efforts.</li><li>Good understanding of security protocols for web interfaces</li><li>Experience working on application security vulnerabilities remediation for .NET &amp; Java stack</li><li>Experience providing top-tier support for Application Security &amp; 2 or more of the information security technology areas: 1) Access Control, 2) Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Planning, 3) Cryptography, 4) Information Security and Risk Management 5) Legal, Regulations, 6) Compliance and Investigations, 7) Operations Security, 8) Physical (Environmental) Security, 9) Security Architecture and Design, 10) Telecommunications and Network Security.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Pay Transparency Statement<br><br></u></strong>For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $83,520 to $167,040.<br><br>Locations:  California; Colorado; Nevada; Washington State; Jersey City, NJ; New York City, NY; Ithaca, NY and Westchester County, NY<br><br>In addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, non-discriminatory factors set by the company.  The company is fully committed to ensuring equal pay opportunities for equal work regardless of gender, race, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local pay equity laws <strong>.<br></strong><ul><li>The salary range is the range Elevance Health in good faith believes is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future and actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level. Even within the range, the actual compensation will vary depending on the above factors as well as market/business considerations. No amount is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable under the terms and conditions of the applicable policies and plans. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Government Statement<br><br></u></strong>If this job is assigned to any Government Business Division entity, the applicant and incumbent fall under a 'sensitive position' work designation and may be subject to additional requirements beyond those associates outside Government Business Divisions. Requirements include but are not limited to more stringent and frequent background checks and/or government clearances, segregation of duties principles, role specific training, monitoring of daily job functions, and sensitive data handling instructions. Associates in these jobs must follow the specific policies, procedures, guidelines, etc. as stated by the Government Business Division in which they are employed<br><br>Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health. Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.<br><br><strong>Be part of an Extraordinary Team<br><br></strong>Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?<br><br>We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.<br><br>The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide – and Elevance Health approves – a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.<br><br>Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact ability@icareerhelp.com for assistance.<br><br>EEO is the Law<br><br>Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran<br><br>Please use the links below to review statements of protection from discrimination under Federal law for job applicants and employees.<br><ul><li>EEO Policy Statement</li><li>Know Your Rights</li><li>Pay Transparency</li><li>Privacy Notice for California Residents<br></li></ul>Elevance Health, Inc. is anE-verify Employer (https://www.e-verify.gov/sites/default/files/everify/posters/EVerifyParticipationPoster.pdf)<br><br>Need Assistance?<br><br>Email us (elevancehealth@icareerhelp.com) or call 1-877-204-7664

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way—all so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.<br><br>The CRM Technical Architect is responsible for designing a robust global CRM (Customer Relationship Management) solution for Cision and its entities. This role involves leveraging expertise in Salesforce platform and applications to establish a long-term roadmap for consolidating instances worldwide. The architect will ensure an optimal technical design, eliminating technical dept and ensuring efficiency.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Duties And Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Engages in close collaboration with both IT and Business teams to establish a holistic and forward-thinking quote to cash roadmap and strategy for long-term success. </li><li>Designs data and process integrations that seamlessly connect upstream and downstream processes.</li><li>Takes the lead in scoping major projects to ensure their successful execution.</li><li>Provides recommendations for module and feature adoption to enhance quote to cash system’s functionality.</li><li>Advise on the most effective strategy for consolidating global Salesforce instances to optimize efficiency and streamline operations. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Required Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS in Computer Science (or BA in relevant field) </li><li>12+ years with Salesforce technology experience </li><li>Salesforce Certified Technical Architect preferred. </li><li>Comprehensive knowledge of theories, concepts and practices and ability to use in complex, difficult and/or unprecedented situations.</li><li>Experience with Software, Technology, and/or Marketing Solutions industries are desired. <br></li></ul>As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire , a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.<br><br>Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity &amp; Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com .<br><br>Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses.<br><br>Cision is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Cision will take the steps to assure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact hr.support@cision.com<br><br>Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.<br><br>
description_json: Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way—all so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.<br><br>The CRM Technical Architect is responsible for designing a robust global CRM (Customer Relationship Management) solution for Cision and its entities. This role involves leveraging expertise in Salesforce platform and applications to establish a long-term roadmap for consolidating instances worldwide. The architect will ensure an optimal technical design, eliminating technical dept and ensuring efficiency.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Duties And Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Engages in close collaboration with both IT and Business teams to establish a holistic and forward-thinking quote to cash roadmap and strategy for long-term success. </li><li>Designs data and process integrations that seamlessly connect upstream and downstream processes.</li><li>Takes the lead in scoping major projects to ensure their successful execution.</li><li>Provides recommendations for module and feature adoption to enhance quote to cash system’s functionality.</li><li>Advise on the most effective strategy for consolidating global Salesforce instances to optimize efficiency and streamline operations. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Required Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS in Computer Science (or BA in relevant field) </li><li>12+ years with Salesforce technology experience </li><li>Salesforce Certified Technical Architect preferred. </li><li>Comprehensive knowledge of theories, concepts and practices and ability to use in complex, difficult and/or unprecedented situations.</li><li>Experience with Software, Technology, and/or Marketing Solutions industries are desired. <br></li></ul>As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire , a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. title: Utility Engineer (31296)
description: <strong>IT Software Engineer II Data Products <br><br></strong><strong> Remote - Chicago IL, California, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, South Carolina, Virginia, Wisconsin, Washington D.C. <br><br></strong>The American Medical Association (AMA) is the nation's largest professional Association of physicians and a non-profit organization. We are a unifying voice and powerful ally for America's physicians, the patients they care for, and the promise of a healthier nation. To be part of the AMA is to be part of our Mission to promote the art and science of medicine and the betterment of public health.<br><br>We continuously work to embed equity in our internal practices and are committed to increasing the diversity of our staff across all levels of the organization. We intentionally work to create the right conditions to enable our employees to feel that they can be their authentic selves and fully participate in the life of the enterprise.<br><br>We encourage and support professional development for our employees, and we are dedicated to social responsibility. We invite you to learn more about us and we look forward to getting to know you.<br><br>We have an opportunity for a remote IT Software Engineer, Data Products our Software Strategy and Development team. As a IT Software Engineer, Data Products you will Analyze, design, develop and unit test software solutions (minimal to medium complexity) for business problems. Design, develop, configure, unit test, implement, upgrade, document, maintain, enhance, and support various software systems.Conducts assignments as directed under moderate supervision.<br><br><strong> RESPONSIBILITIES: <br><br></strong><strong> System Development <br></strong><ul><li> Participate in system development life cycle for new solutions as well as enhancements, including requirements analysis, design, and work estimation activities. </li><li> In addition, some projects may require a more iterative approach to software development depending on the methodology being utilized. </li><li> Develop exceptional software solutions to specified end-user business requirements, user stories and complete unit testing for all software development. <br><br></li></ul><strong> System Maintenance <br></strong><ul><li> Participate in technology renewal activities such as applying new software upgrades, patches, and completion of any required programming, testing, and improvements. </li><li> Work with the designated manager to provide operational system support. </li><li> Participate in “break-fix” issue resolution. </li><li> Assist proper validation with end-users to ensure system issue resolution. <br><br></li></ul><strong> System Scale &amp; Optimization <br></strong><ul><li> Proactively raise concerns, issues, and risks regarding assignments to management in a timely manner. </li><li> Share intellectual knowledge, learn, and understand existing application systems, and participate in cross-training with other team members. </li><li> Identify opportunities to simplify and/or optimize current technology investments and/or recommend new technologies for consideration. </li><li> Report project status regularly to project manager. <br><br></li></ul><strong>May Include Other Responsibilities As Assigned<br><br></strong><strong> REQUIREMENTS: <br></strong><ul><li> 3+ years’ experience with software development and/or analysis in applicable information systems tools and technology. Broad technical skills necessary, with a solid understanding of internet/intranet technology. </li><li> Understanding of the systems development life cycle (SDLC) in a Web based development environment. Familiarity with Internet/Intranet environments required. </li><li> HS diploma or equivalent required. BS or BA degree in information technology or related field or equivalent experience is preferred. </li><li> Ability to develop, debug, data analysis, problem analysis, resolve issues, and unit test within web-based application. Knowledge and understanding of the concepts and techniques of object-oriented design development is desirable. </li><li> Ability to effectively create unit test plan and ability to effectively unit test application development enhancements. Demonstrates an understanding of test-driven development.Experience with automated testing tools such as Selenium a plus. </li><li> Ability to work well with people from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience and varying levels within the organization. Demonstrated ability to work well within a team of software engineers on project tasks. </li><li> Understanding of non-for-profit and/or healthcare related business processes a plus. </li><li> Ability to demonstrate effective problem-solving capabilities required. </li><li> Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Manages own time effectively and requires minimal supervision. </li><li> Ability to express technical concepts effectively verbally and in writing. </li><li> Ability to travel occasionally, work long hours and meet with vendors and mid-level business leaders. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Additional Technical Skills<br></strong><ul><li> Understanding of NoSQL database technology preferred. </li><li> Experience with collaboration tools such as SharePoint and Lync a plus. </li><li> Experience with version control software and source code repositories such as Subversion or Github a plus. </li><li> Experience with more agile based or iterative software development methodologies a plus. <br><br></li></ul>The pay range for this position in Chicago IL, California, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, South Carolina, Virginia, Wisconsin, or Washington D.C. is 80k-$109k. This is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. An employee’s pay within the salary range will be based on numerous factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, experience, skills, geographical location and business or organizational needs.<br><br>We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity in our workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. As an EOE/AA employer, the American Medical Association will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant’s race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity and veteran or disability status.<br><br><strong> THE AMA IS COMMITTED TO IMPROVING THE HEALTH OF THE NATION</strong>

title: Application Engineer
description: <p><strong>Senior Analyst – Development and Acquisitions</strong></p><p><strong> </strong></p><p>Leftbank Holdings is a private-equity real estate development firm based in Chicago. We invest across multiple asset classes including multifamily and industrial, and we currently have investments in Tennessee, Massachusetts, New Jersey, and California. Recently, the firm has acquired several large-scale development sites for the development of over 1,300 new multifamily units.</p><p><br></p><p>Our growing firm is looking to add a senior analyst to the team. An incoming senior analyst would get in-depth exposure to all aspects of development, from underwriting to negotiating Purchase and Sale Agreements through Due Diligence, Zoning, Construction, and ultimately the sale of stabilized properties. This is an entrepreneurial environment that recognizes and rewards team members for hard work; employees have ample opportunities to expand their contribution and grow with the firm. This position would receive mentorship from senior members of the acquisitions team and exposure to the managing partners of the company.</p><p><br></p><p><strong> Responsibilities</strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>Review investment offering memoranda</li><li>Create and manipulate financial models and PowerPoint presentations</li><li>Provide analytical support to the Partners</li><li>Underwrite new opportunities including due diligence, market research, and comparable leasing and sale information</li><li>Prepare memoranda for lenders, investors, and partners</li><li>Coordinate acquisitions and development processes</li><li>Contribute to meetings with potential equity and debt capital partners</li><li>Assist in managing the acquisitions pipeline by staying in touch with sellers and brokers</li><li>Assist in other projects and requests as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong> Qualifications, Skills, Experience</strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li><strong><em>Background in finance, accounting, economics, or real estate required</em></strong></li><li><strong><em>At least 1 year of experience in real estate development or multifamily acquisitions required</em></strong></li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Ability to think critically and work both independently and as part of a team in an entrepreneurial environment</li><li>Self-starter with a high level of intellectual curiosity and motivation</li><li>Highly organized with strong attention to detail</li><li>Personality that enjoys mentorship and learning</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>To Apply and Other Information</strong></p><p><br></p><p>This is a full-time position located in Chicago, IL. Employees have the opportunity to invest in projects, and Leftbank is willing to sponsor qualified candidates who require an H-1B visa. Benefits include health insurance, dental insurance, unlimited PTO, unlimited sick days, unlimited education spending, 401k matching, and free snacks and drinks.</p>

title: Software Engineer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote-United States only (TimeZone: EST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $100 – $112/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Qualities that will help you thrive in this role are:<br></strong><ul><li>You have familiarity with some of the following: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP), creating dashboards in tools such as Looker or Tableau for monitoring and insights, building and monitoring cloud services, infrastructure as code technologies such as Terraform, AWS Cloud Formation, Ansible, etc, Big Data experience with tools such as Spark.</li><li>You understand that being an effective software engineer is about communicating with people as much as it is about writing code</li><li>You are generous with your time and experience, and can mentor and learn from other engineers</li><li>You can tackle unconstrained problems and know when to seek help</li><li>You are flexible with languages and tools and willing to learn whatever is necessary to complete the job.</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>What’s the role?<br><br></strong>Our client's Data Enablement organization's mission is to enable the use of data at scale and to unlock learning through experimentation. As part of the Data Governance &amp; Privacy team, you will join a highly visible team with a top priority of protecting sensitive information of our client's buyers and sellers. The team is responsible for building services and processes to protect Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in their data warehouses. You'll be part of our client's journey to modernize how they protect personal data<br><br>They work with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP). Languages include Java, Python, PHP and SQL, and they work with technologies like Terraform, Spark, Airflow, and BigQuery. Experience with any of these is helpful but not required; above all, they value curiosity, responsibility, and eagerness to solve complex engineering problems. They're looking for a flexible engineer, who can work with the internal customers, and embraces pivoting to the appropriate tool for the job rather than having deep expertise in single systems<br><br>The technical staff believes that code is craft, and that the work they do is part of a larger creative culture that includes the hundreds of thousands of inspired artists and designers who make the Company such a unique marketplace. They believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. They believe in measuring everything, taking advantage of their continuous deployment system to ship code early and often, and keeping up a blameless culture based on trust and a commitment to learning.<br><br>This is a position reporting to the Engineering Manager, Data Governance &amp; Privacy. For this role, they are considering candidates who are either remote, flex, or office-based. The team is geographically dispersed, but works in North America Time Zones<br><br><strong>What does the day-to-day look like?<br></strong><ul><li>You will build and maintain internal tools for tracking and inventorying GCS file sets using Google Storage Insight</li><li>You will work with your team to develop methods to programmatically apply column tags and Policy Tags on BigQuery data sets to identify and protect Personally Identifiable Information</li><li>You will help measure the team’s progress in our work by creating dashboards and monitoring in tools such as Looker or Tableau<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6589<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

As part of the Data Governance &amp; Privacy team, you will join a highly visible team with a top priority of protecting sensitive information of our client's buyers and sellers. The team is responsible for building services and processes to protect Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in their data warehouses. You'll be part of our client's journey to modernize how they protect personal data<br><br>They work with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP). Languages include Java, Python, PHP and SQL, and they work with technologies like Terraform, Spark, Airflow, and BigQuery. Experience with any of these is helpful but not required; above all, they value curiosity, responsibility, and eagerness to solve complex engineering problems. They're looking for a flexible engineer, who can work with the internal customers, and embraces pivoting to the appropriate tool for the job rather than having deep expertise in single systems<br><br>The technical staff believes that code is craft, and that the work they do is part of a larger creative culture that includes the hundreds of thousands of inspired artists and designers who make the Company such a unique marketplace. They believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. They believe in measuring everything, taking advantage of their continuous deployment system to ship code early and often, and keeping up a blameless culture based on trust and a commitment to learning.<br><br>This is a position reporting to the Engineering Manager, Data Governance &amp; Privacy. For this role, they are considering candidates who are either remote, flex, or office-based. The team is geographically dispersed, but works in North America Time Zones<br><br><strong>What does the day-to-day look like?<br></strong><ul><li>You will build and maintain internal tools for tracking and inventorying GCS file sets using Google Storage Insight</li><li>You will work with your team to develop methods to programmatically apply column tags and Policy Tags on BigQuery data sets to identify and protect Personally Identifiable Information</li><li>You will help measure the team’s progress in our work by creating dashboards and monitoring in tools such as Looker or Tableau<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6589<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Application Security Engineer III
description: <strong>Work in Sweden</strong><p><br></p>Our job offerings are temporarily remote from your home country, but then we will help you migrate to a fantastic country, Sweden! We will provide you with a work permit and an exciting job opportunity.<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>As an Electronics &amp; Software Developer within hardware in the team, you are the hub company and responsible owner of circuit boards at the company. The role involves being an in-house representative, coordinating activities and quality-assuring output from the design partners.<p><br></p>The job includes the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Works with other team members such as hardware engineers, software engineers, and project managers to ensure that the electronic systems and software applications meet the project requirements.</li><li>Responsible for identifying and fixing problems with the electronic systems and software applications they develop.</li><li>Creates documentation for electronic systems and software applications, including design documents, user manuals, and technical specifications.</li><li>Responsible for researching new technologies and trends in the industry to ensure that the electronic systems and software applications they develop are up-to-date and use the latest technologies.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need</strong><p><br></p>Been an incredible individual with a passion for electronics and software with the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field is required.</li><li>3+ years of hands-on experience designing and developing electronic systems.</li><li>Knowledge of programming languages such as C, C++, Java, Python, and others and experience with electronic design software, including analogue and digital circuits, is required.</li><li>Hands-on experience testing software (unit- and integration-level testing, automated testing and static code analysis) and/or electronics testing in a lab environment using engineering measurement techniques.</li><li>Experience from several relevant construction projects is advantageous.</li><li>Experience delivering Medical devices to IEC 60601, IEC 62304, ISO 13485 standards or equivalent.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work in a team environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>We are offering more than just a new job position. We help you to build a new exciting life in one of the world's most innovative and technologically developed countries. Sweden is a creative and trending developer where companies excel in making new features to make life easier and sustainable for humans and the planet. Companies in Sweden offer different benefits to their employees, like respecting working hours, vacations, and special permits to maintain a balance between work and family life.<p><br></p>Our client is an international technology company with the vision of helping their customers, transforming technology into great user experiences with physical and digital solutions. This position is for a customer who designs medical solutions to enhance performance in healthcare, from the hospital to the home.<p><br></p>Do you feel ready to become part of an experienced and innovative company with reliable performance in the real world? Do you want to build the future? If you are a talented electronic and software engineer, this is the opportunity to work for constantly innovating companies and do your part to improve the world.

title: Salesforce Technical Architect
description: <ul><li>Looking for a new Electronics Testing position? *</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring for an experienced Test Engineer to develop manufacturing tests to be performed on every unit that they build to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws. This client manufactures electronics and telematics offerings for the automotive/transportation industry, so we are in need of someone with a manufacturing test experience. This position will be using LabView, Test Stands, along with C# with the flexibility of interchanging these languages.</li><li>Responsibilities:*</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Top Skills:*</li><li>Labview</li><li>C#</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>SQL</li><li>Manufacturing Test</li><li>Test Automation</li><li>Test development/design</li><li>Hardware</li><li>Experience developing test for RF or wireless devices</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>PTO</li><li>Paid Holiday's</li><li>Experience Level:* 5+ years experience<br><br></li></ul>About title: IT Software Engineer II, Data Products
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>LaSalle Network has partnered with a manufacturing organization to hire a motivated and skilled <strong>Interim Accounting Analyst</strong> to join their dynamic team! As an <strong>Interim Accounting Analyst</strong>, you will be responsible for performing a variety of accounting duties, such as reconciling accounts, preparing financial statements and assisting with month-end close processes. You will work alongside a team of experienced professionals, who will guide you and provide opportunities for professional growth.<br><br><strong><u>Interim Accounting Analyst Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Reconcile accounts and ensure accuracy of financial data </li><li> Prepare financial statements and reports </li><li> Assist with month-end close processes, including journal entries and account reconciliations </li><li> Analyze financial data and prepare ad-hoc reports as required </li><li> Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify process improvements and streamline workflows </li><li> Assist in the preparation of audit schedules and responses to auditor inquiries </li><li> Perform other duties as assigned by the Accounting Manager or Director of Finance <br></li></ul><strong><u>Interim Accounting Analyst Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance or related field </li><li> Strong analytical skills and attention to detail </li><li> Proficient in Microsoft Excel and experience with accounting software </li><li> Excellent communication and interpersonal skills </li><li> Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously </li><li> Self-motivated and able to work independently or as part of a team </li><li> Positive attitude and eagerness to learn <br></li></ul>If you are an entry-level candidate looking for an exciting opportunity to kick-start your accounting career, then this <strong>Interim Accounting Analyst</strong> role is for you! We are looking for someone who is passionate about accounting, eager to learn and driven to succeed. Apply today and take the first step towards an exciting career in accounting!<br><br>Thank you,<br><br>Cara Jarosz<br><br>Accounting and Finance Team Lead<br><br>LaSalle Network<br><br><strong> Keywords and Related Terms: </strong> 3e , adarent , elite , legal billing , AP , accounts payable<br><br>LaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v.<br><br>LaSalle Network is the leading provider of direct hire and temporary staffing services. For over two decades, LaSalle has helped organizations hire faster and connect top talent with opportunities, from entry-level positions to the C-suite. With units specializing in Accounting and Finance, Administrative, Marketing, Technology, Supply chain, Healthcare Revenue Cycle, Call Center, Human Resources and Executive Search. LaSalle offers staffing and recruiting solutions to companies of all sizes and across all industries. LaSalle Network is the premier staffing and recruiting firm, earning over 100 culture, revenue and industry-based awards from major publications and having its company experts regularly contribute insights on retention strategies, hiring trends and hiring challenges, and more to national news outlets.<br><br>

As an <strong>Interim Accounting Analyst</strong>, you will be responsible for performing a variety of accounting duties, such as reconciling accounts, preparing financial statements and assisting with month-end close processes. You will work alongside a team of experienced professionals, who will guide you and provide opportunities for professional growth.<br><br><strong><u>Interim Accounting Analyst Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Reconcile accounts and ensure accuracy of financial data </li><li> Prepare financial statements and reports </li><li> Assist with month-end close processes, including journal entries and account reconciliations </li><li> Analyze financial data and prepare ad-hoc reports as required </li><li> Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify process improvements and streamline workflows </li><li> Assist in the preparation of audit schedules and responses to auditor inquiries </li><li> Perform other duties as assigned by the Accounting Manager or Director of Finance <br></li></ul><strong><u>Interim Accounting Analyst Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance or related field </li><li> Strong analytical skills and attention to detail </li><li> Proficient in Microsoft Excel and experience with accounting software </li><li> Excellent communication and interpersonal skills </li><li> Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously </li><li> Self-motivated and able to work independently or as part of a team </li><li> Positive attitude and eagerness to learn <br></li></ul>If you are an entry-level candidate looking for an exciting opportunity to kick-start your accounting career, then this <strong>Interim Accounting Analyst</strong> role is for you! We are looking for someone who is passionate about accounting, eager to learn and driven to succeed. Apply today and take the first step towards an exciting career in accounting!<br><br>Thank you,<br><br>Cara Jarosz<br><br>Accounting and Finance Team Lead<br><br>LaSalle Network<br><br><strong> Keywords and Related Terms: </strong> 3e , adarent , elite , legal billing , AP , accounts payable<br><br>LaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v.<br><br>LaSalle Network is the leading provider of direct hire and temporary staffing services. For over two decades, LaSalle has helped organizations hire faster and connect top talent with opportunities, from entry-level positions to the C-suite. With units specializing in Accounting and Finance, Administrative, Marketing, Technology, Supply chain, Healthcare Revenue Cycle, Call Center, Human Resources and Executive Search. LaSalle offers staffing and recruiting solutions to companies of all sizes and across all industries. LaSalle Network is the premier staffing and recruiting firm, earning over 100 culture, revenue and industry-based awards from major publications and having its company experts regularly contribute insights on retention strategies, hiring trends and hiring challenges, and more to national news outlets.<br><br>

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: *Position is Bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Financial Company is currently seeking a AWS DevOps Engineer with Kafka experience. Candidate will provide subject matter expertise for ongoing support of third-party tools like Kafka, Artifactory, Terraform, and Apigee.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Support the lower environments for incident and problem management</li><li>Resolve complex support issues in non-production environments.</li><li>Have an understanding of Cloud Native applications running on Kubernetes within AWS.</li><li>Assist production support and development staff in debugging environment defects.</li><li>Create procedural and troubleshooting documentation related to cloud native applications</li><li>Write complex automation scripts using common automation tools, such as Jenkins, Ansible, and Terraform</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Systems administration and change management practices</li><li>Message-oriented technologies such as Kafka</li><li>Internet/Web based technologies</li><li>ITLT Best Practices</li><li>Scripting and coding</li><li>Network technologies</li><li>CI/CD tools such as Artifactory, Jenkins, and GIT</li><li>Cloud native applications, including Terraform experience</li><li>Technologies used to support microservices</li><li>Encryption technologies (SSL/TLS, PKI Infrastructure management)</li><li>Security controls as applied to software technologies</li></ul>

title: Software Engineer - Freelance [Remote]
description: <strong>Maven, a</strong> <strong>proprietary trading</strong> firm formed in 2011, is all about trust, your impact, freedom, and team. We have an <strong>internal open-source</strong> approach to create a technology environment that is <strong>low bureaucracy</strong> and <strong>high engineering freedom</strong>, fostering close collaboration between Trading and Tech to ensure novel solutions have swift impact.<p><br></p>Maven has a culture that is relaxed and informal but highly rewarding of strong performance. There's no dress code, a hybrid working model, plenty of free food and regular social events. We have offices in London, Amsterdam, Hong Kong, Sydney and New York and will be opening our Chicago office in early 2022.<p><br></p>Maven's code base is in C++ 20 and we have a modern stack throughout, making extensive use of template and meta programming, Python, FPGA and Julia.<p><br></p>Working from our new Chicago office, you will work alongside traders and other developers to help us expand system connectivity to new markets, optimise order execution algorithms and improve our trading strategies. In this role, the work you will do will have a direct, regular and highly visible impact on the firm's success.<p><br></p>We pride ourselves on being able to rapidly deliver well-engineered software into production. You will be able to see the impact of your work immediately and will be in a unique position to have a direct impact on trading revenue. We make extensive use of automated testing and peer code review to ensure quality and maintainability while keeping time-to-market short.<p><br></p><strong>The skills you will have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent C++(11/14/17)</li><li>Template programming</li><li>Ultra low latency design</li><li>Performance tuning and analysis</li><li>Good numerical skills</li><li>The ability to solve new and unfamiliar problems quickly and creatively</li><li>An efficient and diligent approach with a strong attention to detail</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>An Interest in trading and finance</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Things we would like to see but are not essential:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of financial markets &amp; securities (particularly futures and options)</li><li>Experience in the other programming languages: Python, JavaScript</li><li>Experience with NoSQL and time-series databases</li><li>Knowledge of multiple derivative exchange platforms</li><li>Network communication protocols UDP and TCP</li><li>Network acceleration using proprietary drivers and kernel bypass</li><li>Understanding of and optimization for modern Intel architecture</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What you will be doing with us:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Full lifecycle of software development for market making, working alongside traders and developers in other teams, such as FPGA, data analytics and UI developers.</li><li>Developing low latency exchange connectivity components for new markets.</li><li>Participate in software engineering processes such as peer review, project planning and daily stand-up meetings.</li></ul>

title: Test & Validation Engineer
description: Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, forestry, forklift, and industrial machinery markets, maximizing value for customers through innovative solutions. With a diverse line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels, and a global service network, we tap into the power of data and technology to enhance safety and productivity while optimizing performance. Komatsu supports a myriad of markets, including housing, infrastructure, water, pipeline, minerals, automobile, aerospace, electronics and medical, through its many brands and subsidiaries, including TimberPro, Joy, P&amp;H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC, and Gigaphoton.<br><strong><u>Job Overview<br></u></strong>The <strong>Financial Analyst</strong> is a key role within the Komatsu Organization and will have knowledge of Komatsu Mining Corporation (KMC) Financial Information that is not made known publicly or to all Company employees and will be able to tell the “story” within the financial numbers. This Role interacts with the Director of Finance, KMC Corporate Accounting - FP&amp;A and Financial Excellence, Operations Accounting, Regional Finance Directors, Managers and Controllers, Milwaukee leadership and Internal/External Auditors to name a few.<br><strong><u>Key Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Support financial planning cycle by preparing templates that will be used to gather relevant data from business divisions; load corporate departmental data into SAP/BPC; analyze reconciliation of US GAAP to Standard Variable Margin (“SVM”) reporting. </li><li> Consolidate financial forecasts on a quarterly and annual basis. Compare forecasts with business trends and macro-economic data to determine the reasonableness of the current forecast. </li><li> Consolidate and report monthly the rolling CAPEX plan supporting approvals, purchase order, actual and planned spending for the current fiscal year and three-year plan. </li><li> Obtain variance explanations for capacity costs by business division. </li><li> Decision support including analysis of historical financials, obtain variance explanations, update risks and opportunities to current plan and maintain Key Performance Indicators (“KPI’s”) historical and planned trends. </li><li> Maintain trends for bookings and sales data by region, product, and commodity. </li><li> Prepare monthly flash of financial results to executive leadership. </li><li> Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual bridge analysis. </li><li> Prepare monthly reporting metrics of KPI’s. </li><li> Preparation of monthly presentations to Executive Leadership and quarterly presentations to Komatsu Ltd. Management Committee. </li><li> Review calculation of foreign exchange impact on sales, operating profit, and bookings and backlog compared to prior year and budget. </li><li> Prepare ad hoc financial reports and analysis required by Komatsu Ltd., CFO, EVP Finance, Corporate Controller, Treasury, Tax, Human Resources, and segments. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications/Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance (Discipline Preferred)</li><li>2+ years of experience in Financial Planning &amp; Analysis or Accounting, preferably for a manufacturing or global company. Ability to prepare financial statements and explain results.</li><li>SAP/BPC experience a plus</li><li>High level of proficiency with MS Excel. Proficiency in MS PowerPoint and Word. Especially strong with data analysis. </li><li>Working with and interpreting large amounts of data, developing trend lines, and assisting in formulating action plans.</li><li>Strong analytical, critical thinking, Problem Solving, written / verbal communication and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Attention to detail and accuracy is needed.</li><li>Work both independently and in collaboration with team members.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and manage multiple time-sensitive tasks. Committed to meeting established deliverables accurately and on-time.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Additional Information<br></u></strong>Komatsu is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Test & Validation Engineer
description: Costco IT is responsible for the <strong>technical future of Costco Wholesale</strong>, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks <strong>seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”</strong>.<p><br></p>This is an environment <strong>unlike anything in the high-tech world </strong>and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others.<p><br></p>Come join the <strong>Costco Wholesale IT family</strong>. Costco IT is a dynamic, fast-paced environment, working through exciting transformation efforts. We are building the next generation retail environment where you will be surrounded by dedicated and highly professional employees.<p><br></p>Engineers have deep knowledge and hands-on experience in enterprise-wide platforms, and solve technical problems while working on technology initiatives. Engineers have strong architectural, leadership, and technical skills. They ensure delivery of high quality artifacts, and adhere to and follow Costco’s SDLC. Engineers interact in a highly effective manner with other team members and management, drive innovation, and influence delivery and performance.<p><br></p>The<strong>Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)</strong>will be responsible for maintaining and improving the availability, performance, and capacity of Costco’s SAP Commerce Solution. The SRE will translate Costco’s goals and strategies for system availability, performance, and capacity into designs and plans for technical solutions. The SRE will work with other members of the International Ecommerce team, other Costco employees, and Costco suppliers to implement these solutions. The SRE will also work with the rest of the Global eCommerce team to resolve issues affecting the availability, performance or capacity of Costco’s SAP Commerce Solution.<p><br></p>The SRE will also work with other members of the Global eCommerce team to identify upcoming events that could affect demand on system performance and prepare mitigation plans. The SRE will work with the DevOps team and system architects to implement, maintain, and validate disaster recovery plans and other solutions to avoid or mitigate service interruptions.<p><br></p>The SRE will monitor the availability, performance, and capacity of Costco’s SAP Commerce Solution to identify trends and concerns. Create and disseminate system reliability reports to Costco management in support of planning and decision making. The SRE will also assist in the development of policies, standards, and guidelines for the maintenance and operation of Costco’s overall SAP Commerce Solution.<p><br></p>Additionally, this role will partner with other members of the Technical Operations team, including the Technical Operations Manager, the Software Configuration Engineer, the DevOps team, and the Services Management Team.<p><br></p>If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide<strong> <u>BEST companies “to work for”,</u></strong> simply apply and let your career be reimagined.<p><br></p><strong><u> ROLE </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Partners with project managers, solution leads, and other stakeholders to establish the rough order of magnitude estimates, to create and maintain a robust framework to support applications, and to deliver quality solutions.</li><li>Contributes, interprets, and communicates enterprise, technical, project, and operational strategies to the team.</li><li>Works with teams, management, and stakeholders to conceptualize, design, build, test, and release products</li><li>Shares relevant information among teams.</li><li>Influences and drives adoption of best practices and high quality standards throughout the division.</li><li>Integrates diverse solution components across multiple platforms using industry standard interfaces.</li><li>Tests and resolves problems, performs root cause analysis, identifies gaps, recommends solutions and preventative measures, and leads team members to solution delivery plans.</li><li>Runs proof of concepts and uses diagnostic/debugging skills to solve current challenges in multi-platform systems.</li><li>Orchestrates reviews for system additions and/or enhancements.</li><li>Promotes and supports a culture of compliance, risk avoidance/mitigation, and corporate accountability throughout the organization through technical leadership, knowledge of business need, development and communication of policies, procedures, and plans, and assurance of solution designs that are in compliance with architecture standards, technology guardrails, security, and operational guidelines.</li><li>Provides leadership/mentoring to team members; implements development efficiencies; creates appropriate documentation; drives operational efficiencies and technical growth within the team; and supports the release model.</li><li>Optimizes team efficiency and performance through high level technical direction.</li><li>Provides technical leadership in implementation of applications, strategic planning sessions, documentation of requirements, tool implementation, database query languages, and programming languages.</li><li>Assists in management and operation of site reliability functions related to Costco’s SAP Commerce Solution.</li><li>Develops, establishes, and enforces policies, standards, and guidelines for site reliability.</li><li>Identifies, designs, develops, and deploys tools and processes to monitor, maintain, and report site performance and availability.</li><li>Tracks system performance, capacity, and use experience to create effective strategies for maintaining and improving system performance and availability. Advises the International Ecommerce team on said strategies.</li><li>Uses communication and documentation tools (Jira, BitBucket, Bamboo, Jenkins, etc.) to communicate and coordinate with other team members.</li><li>Applies technical expertise to lead the resolution of system issues related to system performance, availability, and capacity.</li><li>Contributes to and maintains an in-depth understanding of the Non Production and Production architectures, including the hosted server environments, deployed applications, integrated packages, and 3rd party operational tools, particularly as they relate to system performance, availability, and capacity.</li><li>Works with the design, development, QA, technical operations teams, as well as other stakeholders, to maintain the performance, availability, and integrity of Costco’s SAP Commerce solution.</li><li>Communicates effectively with project teams and other participants in ongoing system development to identify and resolve issues, explain solutions, and provide technical expertise.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in the development, maintenance, and operation of highly available Ecommerce sites, specifically those based on SAP Commerce.</li><li>Expertise in the use of monitoring and reporting tools for performance and capacity analysis (e.g., Zabbix, App Dynamics, etc.).</li><li>Expertise in performance testing for web applications.</li><li>Knowledge of Java, Linux, and Relational Database systems (particularly MySQL).</li><li>Hands-on experience operating and maintaining high-availability Ecommerce systems. Past experience tuning and maintaining the performance of Java and Linux systems is desirable.</li><li>Ability to prototype and demonstrate mechanisms for performance improvement, high availability, and system scaling.</li><li>Proficient in the use of the Google products: email, spreadsheet, document, presentation, analytics.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills, as well as a positive attitude.</li><li>Strong communication skills, both oral and written, including presentation skills.</li><li>Demonstrated team-building skills with ability to influence and motivate team members that report to other groups in the organization.</li><li>Adept at assessing issues with ability to devise workable solutions quickly.</li><li>Able to work independently.</li><li>Excellent organizational and planning skills, with experience building tactical plans.</li><li>Flexible; must be able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction; able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates/timelines.</li><li>Experience in negotiating timelines and deliverables with a strong sense of urgency.</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel internationally and adjust work hours to accommodate international teams.</li><li>Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business in a 24x7x365 operations environment - evening, weekend, and holiday work.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Recommended </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2-5 years’ of retail business knowledge preferred.</li><li>Familiarity with Atlassian tools (including JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket, Bamboo).</li><li>Familiarity with scripting tools, including shell scripts, Groovy, Python, and/or Perl.</li><li>Familiarity with principles of Continuous Integration and deployment practices.</li><li>Ability to research and introduce new technologies, practices, and techniques; open to continued learning.</li><li>Familiarity with Program and Project Management practices.</li><li>Experience working on medium and large-scale projects, under both traditional and agile development methodologies.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Systems Development Life Cycle processes, as well as demonstrated experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies.</li><li>Knowledge of French, Spanish, Korean, Mandarin a plus.</li><li>Familiarity with the SAP Commerce platform (hybris) is desirable.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Documents</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cover Letter</li><li>Resume</li></ul><p><br></p>California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice.<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Ranges</u></strong><p><br></p>Level 2 - $145,000 - $175,000, Bonus and Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) eligible<p><br></p>Level 3 - $165,000 - $195,000, Bonus and Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) eligible<p><br></p>Level 4 - $185,000 - $220,000, Bonus and Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) eligible<p><br></p>We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits - medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&amp;D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan to eligible employees.<p><br></p>Costco is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Costco is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to IT-Recruiting@costco.com<p><br></p>If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. In some cases, applicants and employees for selected positions will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.
description_json: Costco IT is responsible for the <strong>technical future of Costco Wholesale</strong>, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks <strong>seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”</strong>.<p><br></p>This is an environment <strong>unlike anything in the high-tech world </strong>and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others.<p><br></p>Come join the <strong>Costco Wholesale IT family</strong>. Costco IT is a dynamic, fast-paced environment, working through exciting transformation efforts. We are building the next generation retail environment where you will be surrounded by dedicated and highly professional employees.<p><br></p>Engineers have deep knowledge and hands-on experience in enterprise-wide platforms, and solve technical problems while working on technology initiatives. Engineers have strong architectural, leadership, and technical skills. They ensure delivery of high quality artifacts, and adhere to and follow Costco’s SDLC. Engineers interact in a highly effective manner with other team members and management, drive innovation, and influence delivery and performance.<p><br></p>The<strong>Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)</strong>will be responsible for maintaining and improving the availability, performance, and capacity of Costco’s SAP Commerce Solution. The SRE will translate Costco’s goals and strategies for system availability, performance, and capacity into designs and plans for technical solutions. The SRE will work with other members of the International Ecommerce team, other Costco employees, and Costco suppliers to implement these solutions. The SRE will also work with the rest of the Global eCommerce team to resolve issues affecting the availability, performance or capacity of Costco’s SAP Commerce Solution.<p><br></p>The SRE will also work with other members of the Global eCommerce team to identify upcoming events that could affect demand on system performance and prepare mitigation plans. The SRE will work with the DevOps team and system architects to implement, maintain, and validate disaster recovery plans and other solutions to avoid or mitigate service interruptions.<p><br></p>The SRE will monitor the availability, performance, and capacity of Costco’s SAP Commerce Solution to identify trends and concerns. Create and disseminate system reliability reports to Costco management in support of planning and decision making. The SRE will also assist in the development of policies, standards, and guidelines for the maintenance and operation of Costco’s overall SAP Commerce Solution.<p><br></p>Additionally, this role will partner with other members of the Technical Operations team, including the Technical Operations Manager, the Software Configuration Engineer, the DevOps team, and the Services Management Team.<p><br></p>If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide<strong> <u>BEST companies “to work for”,</u></strong> simply apply and let your career be reimagined.<p><br></p><strong><u> ROLE </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Partners with project managers, solution leads, and other stakeholders to establish the rough order of magnitude estimates, to create and maintain a robust framework to support applications, and to deliver quality solutions.</li><li>Contributes, interprets, and communicates enterprise, technical, project, and operational strategies to the team.</li><li>Works with teams, management, and stakeholders to conceptualize, design, build, test, and release products</li><li>Shares relevant information among teams.</li><li>Influences and drives adoption of best practices and high quality standards throughout the division.</li><li>Integrates diverse solution components across multiple platforms using industry standard interfaces.</li><li>Tests and resolves problems, performs root cause analysis, identifies gaps, recommends solutions and preventative measures, and leads team members to solution delivery plans.</li><li>Runs proof of concepts and uses diagnostic/debugging skills to solve current challenges in multi-platform systems.</li><li>Orchestrates reviews for system additions and/or enhancements.</li><li>Promotes and supports a culture of compliance, risk avoidance/mitigation, and corporate accountability throughout the organization through technical leadership, knowledge of business need, development and communication of policies, procedures, and plans, and assurance of solution designs that are in compliance with architecture standards, technology guardrails, security, and operational guidelines.</li><li>Provides leadership/mentoring to team members; implements development efficiencies; creates appropriate documentation; drives operational efficiencies and technical growth within the team; and supports the title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: You will play a key role in supporting our domestic and international growth by developing and supporting our D365 Finance solution and its integrations for the Accounting and Finance department. In this role you will be exposed to the technical and business sides of our company as you support both our customers and our Accounting and Finance team by customizing and maintaining our D365 solution. This will include extending the solution using the Power Platform, X++, and C#/.NET development, as well as assisting in DevOps pipeline management and supporting upgrades.<p><br></p><strong>More than just important work</strong>.<p><br></p>Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.<p><br></p><ul><li>Experienced with X++ development</li><li>Experience with Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI)</li><li>Experience with object-oriented development (.NET, C#, MVC, HTML, CSS, JavaScript)</li><li>Experience with Microsoft SQL databases, including development and reporting (SSRS)</li><li>Strong project management and organizational skills</li><li>Eligible to work in the US without sponsorship</li><li>Relocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed)</li><li>COVID-19 vaccination</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Professional accounting or finance experience</li><li>Advanced Excel skills including Power Pivot</li></ul>

title: Electronics & Software Developer
description: Prestigious Financial Institution is currently seeking a ServiceNow Solutions Engineer. Candidate will provide services to an existing Platform team to architect, design, develop and deploy solutions utilizing the ServiceNow platform. Their deliverables will be focused on development and delivery of value-added integration, out-of-box configuration and consultative services for low code software development. They will collaborate with a team of Engineers to design, deploy and integrate various product capabilities.<p><br></p>Successful execution of delivery on Enterprise Technology Solution epics in-scope for enabling IT Service Management and Security Operations within the ServiceNow platform. This person will provide testing and support for ServiceNow upgrade that we have scheduled in early November, where all functionality has been tested/validated for User Acceptance and any bugs have been fixed. Additionally, Architecture/Designs related to Security Operations and the ITSM in the cloud for our roadmap.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Contribute to design, technical direction, and architecture with various teams to build fit for purpose solutions</li><li>Participates in code reviews, proactively identifying and mitigating potential issues and defects as well as assisting with continuous improvement</li><li>Follows agreed upon SDLC procedures to ensure that all information system products and services meet both explicit and implicit quality standards, end-user functional requirements, architectural standards, performance requirements, audit requirements, security rules are upheld, and external facing reporting is represented</li><li>Writes unit and integration tests to maintain quality technology improvements</li><li>Performs application and project risk analysis and recommends quality improvements</li><li>Manage Production Support on system functionality and provide fixes as required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in implementing ServiceNow or similar platforms for ITSM, SecOps and/or GRC/IRM modules</li><li>3+ years of experience with Javascript</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON</li><li>Ability to write clean, bug-free code that is easy to understand and easily maintainable</li><li>Strong understanding of CMDB, including importing customer data</li><li>Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), Agile/Scrum, and DevSecOps methodologies</li><li>BS degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, similar technical field</li></ul>
