title: Test Engineer
description: As a Mobile Engineer you will be responsible for designing, developing, debugging, and troubleshooting innovative software solutions for existing product enhancements and new product applications.<p><br></p>Origami Risk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We thrive and benefit from diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable environment for all employees. We do not discriminate against any individual based upon race, religion, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, color, sex, national origin, age, marital status, military or veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Implements React Native features, including creation of UI Screens, handling of navigational and animation behavior, state management, authentication, API calls, repository logic and DTO transformation . </li><li> Practices test driven development, writing and maintaining both unit and integration tests. </li><li> Builds intuitive, secure, and highly scalable mobile applications. </li><li> Builds responsive mobile applications that work well across multiple screen sizes. </li><li> Develops UI components in isolation. </li><li> Improves code quality through code reviews and pair programming. </li><li> Provides ongoing maintenance, support, and enhancements to existing applications. </li><li> Provides recommendations for continuous improvement. </li><li> Collaborates with product owner, delivery lead, quality assurance and business stakeholders to ensure that features developed meet customer needs. </li><li> Assists with writing documentation. </li><li> Other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field. </li><li> 5+ years of programming experience with mobile development. </li><li> Experience in cross-platform development with React Native with TypeScript for the Android and iOS platforms. </li><li> Experience with build and deployment tool scripting and setup is a plus, experience with Expo Application Services (EAS) is a plus. </li><li> Experience with NativeBase or other component libraries is a plus. </li><li> Experience with a state container desired, Zustand knowledge is a plus. </li><li> Experience with hexagonal architecture and/or dependency injection is a plus. </li><li> Experience with local storage technologies desired, Realm knowledge is a plus. </li><li> Experience with test driven development desired, Jest and Detox libraries knowledge is a plus. </li><li> Experience using Storybook or similar libraries to build UI components in isolation is a plus. </li><li> Experience with logging technologies like Firebase and Sentry.io is a plus. </li><li> Experience with building mobile applications using Xamarin is a plus. </li><li> Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies a plus. </li><li> Risk management and insurance expertise is a plus. </li><li> Prior experience with managing client product implementations is a plus. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Who We Are</strong><p><br></p>Origami Risk is a leading provider of integrated SaaS solutions for risk management, insurance, safety, and compliance. We've designed our single-platform, cloud-based software to be easily configurable to meet the needs of insured corporate and public entities, brokers and risk consultants, insurers and MGAs, third party claims administrators (TPAs), risk pools, and more. To fulfill our singular focus of helping our clients achieve their business objectives, our software is supported by a best-in-class service team of experienced risk, insurance, and safety professionals who have an ideal balance of industry knowledge and technological expertise.<p><br></p>Since its founding in 2009, Origami Risk has received more than two dozen awards for service excellence, technology innovation, and workplace culture. In addition to inclusion in Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500™, a ranking of the 500 fastest-growing tech companies in North America, Origami Risk also has been repeatedly recognized by Inc. magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work” and Best and Brightest® Companies To Work For in the Nation by the National Association for Business Resources (NABR).

To fulfill our singular focus of helping our clients achieve their business objectives, our software is supported by a best-in-class service team of experienced risk, insurance, and safety professionals who have an ideal balance of industry knowledge and technological expertise.<p><br></p>Since its founding in 2009, Origami Risk has received more than two dozen awards for service excellence, technology innovation, and workplace culture. In addition to inclusion in Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500™, a ranking of the 500 fastest-growing tech companies in North America, Origami Risk also has been repeatedly recognized by Inc. magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work” and Best and Brightest® Companies To Work For in the Nation by the National Association for Business Resources (NABR).

title: Interim Accounting Analyst
description: We are hiring multiple  .NET   Developers  for  one of the biggest banking companies! <ul><li>7+ years of development experience required</li><li>Gain experience in Financial Tech</li><li>You will be doing new development and adding new features in .NET Core and Angular</li><li>Must be able to work on W2 (No C2C or sponsorship available)</li><li>24 Month Contract to Hire (Potential to convert full time anytime during the contract!)</li><li>Hybrid once a week out of one of these locations:</li><ul><li>Summit, NJ</li><li>Atlanta, GA</li><li>Chicago, IL</li></ul><li>Top Skills:</li><ul><li>.NET Core</li><li>Angular 6+ (they are on 13)</li></ul><li>Nice to Have:</li><ul><li>Cloud (PCF or Azure)</li><li>Agile<br></li></ul></ul> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: <em>An empty treadmill isn’t compelling, but once someone steps on it, the stories are limitless. Our goal is to connect people emotionally to their fitness journey. We are a global team coming from different cultures and backgrounds with a shared passion to achieve and live our mission of inspiring healthier lives. <br><br></em><em>Inspire. Innovate. Make an impact and join our team!<br><br></em>Our<strong> Software Test Engineer</strong> is responsible for designing and implementing test procedures, including manual and automation testing, in support of our growing Agile-based product development activities on our fitness equipment software. The ideal candidate, with a Computer Science background, will execute manual and automation testing and should have the ability to handle interruptions while fluidly switching between several assignments.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>The engineer must be able to perform the following:<br><ul><li>Familiar with Software-as-a-Service model (SaaS)</li><li>Critical thinking to solve problems unique to developing technologies.</li><li>Regularly apply technical knowledge to daily engineering activities.</li><li>Analyze architecture, code bases to develop critical path experiments to ensure safety and reliability.</li><li>Leverage analysis tools when needed to determine root causes.</li><li>Continuously improve analysis and validation techniques and apply them in daily practice.</li><li>Able to be an independent engineer that understands the project scopes and best-adheres to project timelines / goals.</li><li>Integrate and communicate well with other engineering teams, making known individual contributions and assisting others when necessary.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Skills<br><br></u></strong><strong>Languages / Toolsets<br></strong><ul><li>Java, PostGres, MySQL, Android, Automation (e.g. Monkey Runner, WebDriver, Selenium), Atlassian Suite<br></li></ul><strong>Networks<br></strong><ul><li>TCP / IP, UDP<br></li></ul><strong>Networking Principles<br></strong><ul><li>Analysis Methods, Learning, Failing, Improving, Controlling, Unit Testing, Functional Testing , Code Reviews, Critical Thinking<br></li></ul><strong><u>Testing Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Develop/execute test cases from user stories</li><li>Automate test cases using the tools like (Monkey Runner, WebDriver, Selenium)</li><li>Strong understanding of functional testing, regression testing and Sanity testing</li><li>Good understanding on Agile methodologies and techniques<br></li></ul><strong><u>Operating Systems<br></u></strong><ul><li>Linux Windows</li><li>Exhaustive knowledge is not mandatory, but a candidate is expected to discuss their preference at a high level<br></li></ul><strong><u>Controlled Repositories<br></u></strong><ul><li>Knowledge about controlled code revision methods, GIT, Subversion<br></li></ul><strong>Software Design Principles<br></strong><ul><li>Paradigms, Encapsulation, Patterns, Synchronization and Communication Methods<br></li></ul><strong><u>EXPEREIENCE<br><br></u></strong>3+ years software development or testing experience<br><br><strong><u>EDUCATION<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related discipline<br><br>Want to take the next step in your career?<br><br>Life Fitness takes pride in our talented employees and believe in providing opportunities for further growth and advancement. We encourage you to test your strengths, push your limits and unleash your potential.<br><br>If you feel the open position you see is right for you, we invite you to apply.<br><br><em>Learn more about us here.<br><br></em><em>Life Fitness does not accept applications, inquiries or solicitations from unapproved staffing agencies or vendors.<br><br></em>Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled<br><br>EEO is The Law - click here for more information<br><br>Life Fitness and Workday Privacy Policies

title: Test Engineer
description: <strong>Objectives</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Operate production environments by monitoring availability and taking a holistic view of system health</li><li>Build software and systems to manage platform infrastructure and applications (IaC)</li><li>Improve reliability, quality, cost, and time-to-market of our suite of software solutions</li><li>Measure and optimize system performance</li><li>Provide primary operational support and engineering for multiple large-scale distributed software applications</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work with a team of Site Reliability Engineers to implement DevOps culture, infrastructure reliability, and collaborate to solve day-to-day problems</li><li>Work with development teams and outside contractors to enhance and support existing business applications that focus on health analytics</li><li>Participate in system design consulting, platform management, and capacity planning</li><li>Balance feature development speed and reliability with well-defined service-level objectives</li><li>Gather and analyze metrics from operating systems as well as applications to assist in performance tuning and reliability troubleshooting</li><li>Help optimize costs and ensure compliance with enterprise security and audit requirements</li><li>Spend time on an alternating on-call schedule to troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure problems</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills And Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Amazon Web Services such as EC2, VPC, S3, IAM, EKS, Lambda, RDS</li><li>Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform</li><li>Docker and containerization for development and continuous integration</li><li>Kubernetes cluster administration and related continuous delivery systems using Helm Charts</li><li>Support of applications written in node.js, Ruby on Rails, and React</li><li>Logging and monitoring tools such as Datadog, Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK</li><li>Management of load balancers using HaProxy and ELB</li><li>Linux system administration and networking</li><li>Bash scripting and knowledge of high-level programming languages such as Javascript or Python</li><li>Continuous integration tools such as Github Actions, CircleCI, or Gitlab CI</li><li>Continuous deployment tools such as Jenkins, ArgoCD, or Gitlab</li><li>Administration and performance tuning of postgres databases</li><li>Configuration management using Ansible and Packer</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Skills And Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Performance tuning systems with high volume traffic, large data sets, and complex data analytics queries</li><li>Big Data solutions such as Spark, EMR, and Redshift</li><li>Management of multi-account AWS organizations with AWS Control Tower</li><li>Tableau administration</li></ul><p><br></p>As a leading payments company in healthcare, we guide, price, explain, and pay for care on behalf of insurers and their members. We’re Zelis in our pursuit to align the interests of payers, providers, and consumers to deliver a better financial experience and more affordable, transparent care for all. We partner with more than 700 payers, including the top-5 national health plans, BCBS insurers, regional health plans, TPAs and self-insured employers, over 4 million providers, and 100 million members, enabling the healthcare industry to pay for care, with care. Zelis brings adaptive technology, a deeply ingrained service culture, and a comprehensive navigation through adjudication and payment platform to manage the complete payment process.<p><br></p>Zelis provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.<p><br></p>SCAM ALERT: There is an active nationwide employment scam which is now using Zelis to garner personal information or financial scams. This site is secure, and any applications made here are with our legitimate partner. If you’re contacted by a Zelis Recruiter, please ensure whomever is contacting you truly represents Zelis Healthcare. We will never asked for the exchange of any money or credit card details during the recruitment process. Please be aware of any suspicious email activity from people who could be pretending to be recruiters or senior professionals at Zelis.

This site is secure, and any applications made here are with our legitimate partner. If you’re contacted by a Zelis Recruiter, please ensure whomever is contacting you truly represents Zelis Healthcare. We will never asked for the exchange of any money or credit card details during the recruitment process. Please be aware of any suspicious email activity from people who could be pretending to be recruiters or senior professionals at Zelis.

title: AWS Kafka DevOps Engineer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Direct Hire Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States</li><li>SALARY: $125,000 – $160,000/yr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Required Qualifications <br></strong><ul><li>5+ years technical software experience </li><li>Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>Proficiency with server-side languages such as PHP</li><li>Proficiency with database technology such as SQL Server and MySQL</li><li>Database design and management, including being up on the latest practices and associated versions</li><li>Strong understanding of software architecture, data structures, and computer science fundamentals </li><li>Strong security background (comfortable working with PII/sensitive data)</li><li>Experience with agile and fast-paced software development methodologies </li><li>Strong organizational, project management, and communication skills</li><li>Good problem-solving skills</li><li>Attention to detail<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Prior experience working and communicating directly with clients</li><li>Laravel and Node.js experience helpful</li><li>Familiarity with CSS preprocessors, bundlers, and associated languages/syntaxes/libraries (e.g., Sass, Less, and webpack)</li><li>An eye for design and user experience</li><li>Technical literacy and hands-on experience across the software stack, infrastructure, and dev-ops</li><li>Knowledge of Enterprise HR systems (WorkDay, SuccessFactors, Oracle, SAP)</li><li>Proficiency with Git</li><li>Appreciation for clean and well documented code</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong>Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be working on the design, architecture, development, and innovation of customized HR software for some of the world’s most sophisticated companies. You will use PHP, SQL, JavaScript, and CSS to deploy software quickly to meet their needs. Our work is fast-paced, creative, and flexible–your days will be too! You will spend time problem solving with clients live, helping them see the range of what’s possible, building what they need, and working directly with HR experts. You will work alongside client team-members and thrive on the responsibility to own large projects from conceptualization to sunset.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Build the software development process from conception to deployment </li><li>Maintaining and upgrading the software following deployment </li><li>Managing the end-to-end life cycle for the production of software and applications </li><li>Modifying and testing changes to previously developed applications </li><li>Deliver high quality code in a fast and efficient manner </li><li>Must be fluent in all things PHP, MySQL, and Javascript </li><li>Develop front-end and back-end software using PHP/MySQL and HTML/Javascript/CSS with Vue.js or React.js </li><li>Identify and mitigate end-to-end security concerns </li><li>Ensuring the entire stack is designed and built for speed and scalability </li><li>Mentoring other engineers </li><li>Work across the organization to foster a culture of architecture that allows for iterative, autonomous development and future scaling. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6496<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: C++ Developer - Market Making
description: Job Summary This role performs and implements activities that impacts components / processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens business software products OR Digital/Online application in an Agile environment. Work is typically received in short-term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of defined procedures that provide desired functionality to digital solutions, products and programs, typically for intermediary, basic to complex systems. Implements activities that influence entry to mid-level components of the functional area Job Responsibilities Writes code that meets specifications. Develops software applications and tools. Completes programming and performs testing and debugging applications Develops software applications and tools using Agile development methodologies. Participates actively in the design, architecture and build phases, to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. Participates in the evaluation of compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features. Develops professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Builds productive internal/external working relationships. Receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Usually works with some supervision, conferring with superiors on unusual or complex matters Demonstrates proficiency in several areas of the professional function. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization. Interacts with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities. Acts as individual contributor as well as team member Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans About Walgreens Boots Alliance Walgreens Boots Alliance (Nasdaq: WBA) is a global leader in retail pharmacy, impacting millions of lives every day through dispensing medicines, and providing accessible, high-quality care. With more than 170 years of trusted healthcare heritage and innovation in community pharmacy, the company is meeting customers and patients needs through its convenient retail locations, digital platforms and health and beauty products. Including equity method investments, WBA has a presence in more than 25 countries, employs more than 450,000 people and has more than 21,000 stores. WBAs purpose is to help people across the world lead healthier and happier lives. The company is proud of its contributions to healthy communities, a healthy planet, an inclusive workplace and a sustainable marketplace. WBA is a participant of the United Nations Global Compact and adheres to its principles-based approach to responsible business. WBA is included in FORTUNEs 2021 list of the Worlds Most Admired Companies*. This is the 28th consecutive year that WBA or its predecessor company, Walgreen Co., has been named to the list. description_json: Job Summary This role performs and implements activities that impacts components / processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens business software products OR Digital/Online application in an Agile environment. Work is typically received in short-term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of defined procedures that provide desired functionality to digital solutions, products and programs, typically for intermediary, basic to complex systems. Implements activities that influence entry to mid-level components of the functional area Job Responsibilities Writes code that meets specifications. Develops software applications and tools. Completes programming and performs testing and debugging applications Develops software applications and tools using Agile development methodologies. Participates actively in the design, architecture and build phases, to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. Participates in the evaluation of compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features. Develops professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Builds productive internal/external working relationships. Receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Usually works with some supervision, conferring with superiors on unusual or complex matters Demonstrates proficiency in several areas of the professional function. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization. Interacts with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities. Acts as individual contributor as well as team member Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans About Walgreens Boots Alliance Walgreens Boots Alliance (Nasdaq: WBA) is a global leader in retail pharmacy, impacting millions of lives every day through dispensing medicines, and providing accessible, high-quality care. With more than 170 years of trusted healthcare heritage and innovation in community pharmacy, the company is meeting customers and patients needs through its convenient retail locations, digital platforms and health and beauty products. Including equity method investments, WBA has a presence in more than 25 countries, employs more than 450,000 people and has more than 21,000 stores. WBAs purpose is to help people across the world lead healthier and happier lives. The company is proud of its contributions to healthy communities, a healthy planet, an inclusive workplace and a sustainable marketplace. title: Financial Analyst
description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong>The Trade Operations and Asset Services Team provides post-execution trade support, daily reconciliation of cash and security positions, corporate actions processing, and operational support for client implementations.<br><br>LGIMA is currently seeking a candidate to serve as a Senior Analyst within the Fixed Income Operations team. The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting post-execution trade processing for the Active Fixed Income and LDI teams and processing related corporate action activity.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li> Ensure timely settlement of trades and actively chase on fails </li><li> Process TBA trade bookings, confirmation, and SIFMA assignment documentation </li><li> Liaise with portfolio managers regarding corporate action elections and postings </li><li> Investigate and resolve data transfer breaks between internal systems </li><li> Coordinate with custodian banks and other external parties to meet cut off times for instructing and reporting on daily trade activity </li><li> Liaise with Business Relations team for fund setups as necessary, monitoring all new account activity closely to ensure successful onboarding </li><li> Partner with global operations teams to enhance capabilities and coverage domestically </li><li> Proactively seek opportunities to leverage technology and automate manual processes </li><li>Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to support changing business deliverables<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li> Proven experience (5+ years) in a fixed income operations role </li><li> Strong understanding of fixed income confirmations and settlements processes and platforms, including SWIFT, custodian portals, CTM, Alert, and AccessFintech </li><li> Team oriented individual with collaborative nature </li><li> Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills </li><li> Proactive mindset with focus on risk mitigation and quick resolution of issues </li><li> Willingness to approach existing processes with fresh outlook and challenge the status quo where appropriate </li><li> Strong communication skills; ability to articulate issues accurately and efficiently </li><li> Thrives when met with competing priorities in a fast paced, deadline driven environment </li><li> Strong research and root cause analysis skills with desire to drive systemic change </li><li>Knowledge of SQL and VBA a plus<br><br></li></ul><strong> EOE Statement <br><br></strong>As an EOE employer, Legal &amp; General Investment Management America will extend equal opportunity to all employees<br><br>and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ancestry,<br><br>national origin, age, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, pregnancy, military status, and/or any<br><br>other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state or local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. (2020)

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: <ul><li>Company with sports and technology at its core - with mobile and web apps|Use React Native with small team of 6 developers<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client was founded over 20 years ago in the Spectator Sports industry, gearing their platform to serve a wide array of youth sports organizations across the US. They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports teams in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 1M onboarded users. Their main challenge now is merging their technology to integrate with a company they acquired, while continuing to maintain operation of their platforms with minimal downtime. These are high impact projects that enrich the experiences of youth athletes, and simplify<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>The Selected Software Developer will:<br><ul><li>Use React Native for all mobile development projects.</li><li>Remain up to date with development breakthroughs and follows best practices.</li><li>Use, rework, and adapt existing web applications for mobile apps.</li><li>Create and test software prototypes when needed.</li><li>Develop client displays and user interfaces in a Fullstack capacity.</li><li>Perform complete testing of web applications-unit and end-to-end automated testing, engaging users as necessary.</li><li>Develop SQL database-driven web interfaces.</li><li>Utilize front-end web technologies to create interactive user experiences with rich functionality.</li><li>Take charge of story development without needing micromanagement.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong>The Successful Software Developer has:<br><ul><li>8+ years of Mobile experience.</li><li>4+ years of React Native.</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.</li><li>Boot camp certificate (with at least 2 additional years of experience).</li><li>Strong proficiency with React Native.</li><li>Exposure or experience working in C#/.NET is preferred but not required.</li><li>Experience using SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience.</li><li>Experience working with REST APIs.</li><li>Strong attention to detail, always looking to create robust solutions that minimize excess redundancies.</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.</li><li>Clear documentation.</li><li>A desire to have an impact on the world with the software being developed.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br><br></strong>What's on Offer for the Selected Software Developer?<br><ul><li>Base salary very open for the right candidate, in the range of 140k-180k depending on experience.</li><li>Affordable comprehensive healthcare plans, with more than 80% of out of pocket costs covered.</li><li>401k with 4% company match, no waiting period for matched contributions.</li><li>Unlimited Paid Time Off program, with no expectations, thresholds, or strings attached.</li><li>Person first model, i.e. you're a person before you're a developer allowing flexibility for when life just happens.</li><li>Hybrid in the office in Northbrook up to twice a week, can make exceptions as needed.</li><li>Dynamic culture, tech minded individuals looking to make a difference with their coding.</li><li>Mentorship, management, and leadership opportunities within.</li><li>Onboarding program to make the transition period run smoothly.</li><li>Optional outings to visit Chicago Sports teams, games, press events, networking events.<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Emily Bodett<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6054290</strong>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong>The individual will be primarily responsible for independently conducting fundamental credit research on current and potential holdings within assigned sectors in the US high yield and/or leveraged loan markets.<br><br>A high yield credit analyst will assist Portfolio Managers that manage US and Global High Yield funds. The analyst will maintain models, aggregate data, and interact with management teams to help assess a debt issuer’s risk/return profile. The analyst should be comfortable with capital structure and cash flow analyses. The analyst should be able to aggregate data for the purpose of ongoing monitoring of purchased securities. The analyst should maintain relationships with sell side and rating agency counterparts. The analyst will work closely with portfolio managers in the construction of portfolios.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities</strong><ul><li> Conduct fundamental corporate credit research on US high yield issuers</li><ul><li> Produce financial models to assess credit quality </li><li> Meet with management teams on a regular basis to help inform investment opinions </li><li> Interact with market participants to bolster data collection to support investment views (e.g., rating agency analysts, buy side/sell side counterparts, industry experts) </li><li> Utilize alternative data sources to complement traditional data collection </li></ul><li> Deliver timely investment recommendations on issuers within the high yield and/or leveraged loan markets</li><ul><li> Assess credit quality through a proprietary scenario analyses template </li><li> Daily communication with portfolio managers in both the US and UK </li></ul><li> Assess macroeconomic factors and their impact on covered issuers as well as industrial and financial sectors</li><ul><li> Participate in monthly HY strategy meetings to contribute to team macroeconomic views description_json: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong>The individual will be primarily responsible for independently conducting fundamental credit research on current and potential holdings within assigned sectors in the US high yield and/or leveraged loan markets.<br><br>A high yield credit analyst will assist Portfolio Managers that manage US and Global High Yield funds. The analyst will maintain models, aggregate data, and interact with management teams to help assess a debt issuer’s risk/return profile. The analyst should be comfortable with capital structure and cash flow analyses. The analyst should be able to aggregate data for the purpose of ongoing monitoring of purchased securities. The analyst should maintain relationships with sell side and rating agency counterparts. The analyst will work closely with portfolio managers in the construction of portfolios.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities</strong><ul><li> Conduct fundamental corporate credit research on US high yield issuers</li><ul><li> Produce financial models to assess credit quality </li><li> Meet with management teams on a regular basis to help inform investment opinions </li><li> Interact with market participants to bolster data collection to support investment views (e.g., rating agency analysts, buy side/sell side counterparts, industry experts) </li><li> Utilize alternative data sources to complement traditional data collection </li></ul><li> Deliver timely investment recommendations on issuers within the high yield and/or leveraged loan markets</li><ul><li> Assess credit quality through a proprietary scenario analyses template </li><li> Daily communication with portfolio managers in both the US and UK </li></ul><li> Assess macroeconomic factors and their impact on covered issuers as well as industrial and financial sectors</li><ul><li> Participate in monthly HY strategy meetings to contribute to team macroeconomic views <br></li></ul></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li> Leveraged finance (high yield bonds and/or leveraged loans) experience of 5-12 years </li><li> Experience in evaluating fundamental credit factors that could impact the valuation of a fixed income security </li><li> Experience in financial forecasting and maintaining fundamental earnings models </li><li> Deep understanding of title: ServiceNow Solutions Engineer ITSM
description: <ul><li>Are you interested in a Software Engineering Role within the Chicago Suburbs?! Is so, see below for more details on this great opportunity: *</li><li>Description:*</li><li>Candidate will be working with C and C++ within a VxWorks operating systems for software development</li><li>Person will be doing both embedded C development along with C++ object oriented programming</li><li>Some of the code is C++ OOD development, design patterns, deeper OO concepts</li><li>Embedded software development and doing application level while working with many different communication protocols</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>Must have a minimum of 3+ years of experience in working with C and C++</li><li>Must have experience in real-time systems<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Mobile Engineer (Hybrid)
description: <strong>Job Summary:<br><br></strong>This role performs and implements activities that impacts components / processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens business software products OR Digital/Online application in an Agile environment. Work is typically received in short-term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of defined procedures that provide desired functionality to digital solutions, products and programs, typically for intermediary, basic to complex systems. Implements activities that influence entry to mid-level components of the functional area<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Writes code that meets specifications. Develops software applications and tools. </li><li>Completes programming and performs testing and debugging applications</li><li>Develops software applications and tools using Agile development methodologies. </li><li>Participates actively in the design, architecture and build phases, to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. </li><li>Participates in the evaluation of compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features. Develops professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. </li><li>Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. </li><li>Builds productive internal/external working relationships. </li><li>Receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Usually works with some supervision, conferring with superiors on unusual or complex matters</li><li>Demonstrates proficiency in several areas of the professional function. </li><li>Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization</li><li>Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization. </li><li>Interacts with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities. </li><li>Acts as individual contributor as well as team member</li><li>Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. </li><li>Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. </li><li>Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. </li></ul><strong>About Walgreens and WBA<br><br></strong>Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree and at least 2 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience OR High School/ GED and at least 4 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience</li><li>Experience writing code for applications or automation</li><li>Experience with programming languages for online applications, microservices, APIs or mobile applications</li><li>Experience building, testing applications or automation</li><li>Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle</li><li>Experience creating coding solutions to fix moderate problems/issues</li><li>Willing to travel up to 5% of the time for business purposes (domestically and/or internationally). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar field</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment</li><li>At least 2 years of progressively complex related experience. </li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems</li><li>DevOps</li><li>2+ years of on experience is Deployment automation for various applications IaaS, PaaS platforms</li><li>2+ years of hands-on experience in automation software like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform or equivalent</li><li>Good knowledge of GIT workflows and Repo management</li><li>Excellent knowledge in implement of CI/CD pipelines for Cloud deployments using containers/Docker</li><li>Working knowledge of Kubernetes and microservices architecture and other DevOps tooling and Linux environments</li><li>Working knowledge or experience of software development for Web and Mobile applications in agile environments</li><li>Web/backend Developer</li><li>Previous experience with full stack development ranging from front-end user interfaces to back-end systems</li><li>Proficient in back-end languages like Java, Node/Typescript, .NET, Python etc. with exposure to performance optimization of high traffic &amp; scalable services</li><li>Hands on with modern UI frameworks like React with good knowledge of front-end design pattern (stateless components, conditional rendering, controlled components, hooks etc.)</li><li>Excellent knowledge of distributed SQL (e.g., Oracle, MySQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra) design &amp; consumption patterns</li><li>Have an exposure to implementation, capacity planning &amp; performance tuning of Cloud technologies – Azure (ACS, AKS), Google, IBM, AWS or Cloud Foundry</li><li>Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing &amp; operations</li><li>Mobile Developer</li><li>2 years of Mobile App development experience and hands on skills in Swift, SwiftUI, Objective C ( iOS)</li><li>2 Years of Mobile App development experience and hands-on skills in Kotlin ( Android)</li><li>Experience in building client applications consuming JSON based on APIs</li><li>Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing &amp; operations</li><li>Software Engineer in Test</li><li>3+ years of experience as an SDET, Developer, or strong Automation Engineer</li><li>Experience developing automation in at least one OO language - Java, C#/C++, Python or web based technologies</li><li>Proven experience creating automation frameworks and tools to support test automation</li><li>Experience working in a Microservices based architecture in a cloud native environment</li><li>Data &amp; Analytics</li><li>2 years of experience in integrating, transforming and consolidating data from various structured and unstructured data systems for building analytics solutions in any cloud Platforms: Microsoft Azure, AWS or GCP</li><li>Experience with relational and NoSQL databases such as Cosmos, Cassandra</li><li>2 years of Experience in SQL, Java or Python programming</li><li>Experience in Data Pipeline and integration workflow management tools: Talend, Store Proc, Change Data Capture (CDC), Spark &amp; Azure API</li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending fixes to resolve problems</li><li>Knowledge in Azure cloud technologies like Data Flow, Data Bricks, Azure Synapse, Power BI Analytics</li><li>Experience in any of reporting tools like Power BI, Business objects, Cognos or Tableau</li></ul>

title: .Net Developer
description: Medline Industries continues to grow, and grow, and grow. In fact, we've enjoyed DOUBLE DIGIT growth in 54 of the past 55 years! And we are AGAIN named as a Chicago Tribune Top Employer! Doesn't that sound like the kind of place you'd want to join?<p><br></p>Medline has an immediate opening for an experienced Java developer to join our software development team! This position will be responsible for designing and implementing solutions for various business initiatives. The ideal candidate is someone who is self-motivated, pleasant to collaborate with, and constantly seeking to improve and expand their skills.<p><br></p>In return, Medline offers a business casual, entrepreneurial work environment with strong growth potential.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Research, plan, design, code, test, deploy, and document high quality software </li><li>Troubleshoot and resolve software defects</li><li>Participate in code reviews</li><li>Adhere to established software development standards</li><li>Facilitate design meetings with users, management, and architects</li><li>Contribute to the continuous improvement of software development practices</li><li>Engage in continuous improvement of one’s own skill set, both technical and non-technical </li><li>Stay current on industry trends and best practices and promote their use as applicable</li><li>Develop a solid understanding of Medline’s business domain and apply this to all software development activities</li><li>Collaborate professionally with customers and colleagues</li><li>Comply with all company policies and procedures and governmental regulatory mandates</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>COVID-19 Vaccination</strong><p><br></p>Please be aware that Medline requires all employees starting in this position to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. This position will require the successful candidate to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated by their start date. Medline is an equal opportunity employer, and will provide reasonable accommodations to those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated for COVID-19 consistent with federal, state, and local l<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Java (minimum 4 years professionally)</li><li>Cloud and container-based development and deployment (Azure preferred)</li><li>Object oriented design principles and patterns</li><li>Spring framework</li><li>RESTful web service development</li><li>JUnit, Mockito, PowerMock</li><li>SQL</li><li>Git</li><li>Scrum</li></ul><p><br></p>The following experience is desirable, but not required:<p><br></p><ul><li>Docker, Kubernetes, Helm</li><li>Swagger/OpenAPI</li><li>SOAP, OData, GraphQL</li><li>OAuth 2.0, Ping Federate</li><li>HTTP protocol</li><li>JSON, XML</li><li>JEE (JSP, Servlet, EJB)</li><li>JPA, Hibernate, Spring Data</li><li>Splunk</li><li>HTML, CSS, JavaScript</li><li>UI Development frameworks (Angular, React, Bootstrap)</li><li>4 year degree in Computer Science or a related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Medline</strong><p><br></p><em>Medline Industries is the largest privately held manufacturer and distributor of healthcare supplies in the United States, providing more than 550,000 products that serve the entire continuum of care. Our innovative products and programs can be found in most hospitals, extended-care facilities, surgery centers, physician offices, home care dealers, home health agencies and retail outlets.</em><p><br></p><em>Founded in 1910, Medline has grown from a small manufacturer of aprons, surgical gowns and uniforms to a thriving $17 billion global enterprise because of our dedicated people, entrepreneurial spirit and honest values.</em><p><br></p><em>Again named one of the country’s "Best and Brightest Companies to Work For” and once again named to Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces, Medline has experienced fifty-plus years of consecutive annual growth, and is headquartered in Northfield, IL.</em><p><br></p><strong>Primary Location</strong><p><br></p>US-IL-LIBERTYVILLE<p><br></p><strong>Other Locations</strong><p><br></p>US-IL-CHICAGO, US-IL-Northbrook

title: Software Test Engineer III
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>Our Systems Engineering Integration &amp; Test (SEIT) organization provides complex subsystems and defense electronics. This position can be hired as a Senior (Sr.) Principal Systems Engineer depending on qualifications and years of experience. This position is located at our Rolling Meadows, IL location. This opportunity is available in the Systems Design discipline in SEIT. Duties and responsibilities can include:<br><ul><li>Creating and refining Model Based Systems Engineering Products (System behavioral models, Use Case realizations, State Machines, etc.)</li><li>Generation and update of specifications in DOORS, including requirements traceability</li><li>Functional algorithm development</li><li>Risk assessment and burn down of mitigation steps</li></ul>In addition, the ideal candidate is a subject matter expert (SME) in the field of communication system and antenna design. Specifically, the ideal candidate will have experience in the following specialty areas in regards to antenna design.<br><ul><li>Advanced knowledge and recent experience in one or more of the following areas related to EOIR/RF systems: antennas, transmitters &amp; receivers, sensors, and optics</li><li>Communication hardware, software, and system</li><li>Real-time signal processing</li><li>Requirements analysis and allocation as related to Systems Engineering</li></ul>As part of the SEIT team, a System Design Engineer is exposed to the front-end Systems Engineering process and coordinate across many disciplines to ensure that the system description and requirements are properly and thoroughly defined, captured, and meet the mission need for the end customer.<br><br><strong>Additional $10k sign-on bonus for selected candidates who possess an ACTIVE TS/SCI clearance, and an additional $5k sign-on bonuses to selected candidates who possess an active Polygraph.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>For Sr. Principal Systems Engineer, BS degree in Electrical Engineering or related technical degree with 9+ years (or MS with 7+ years, or PhD with 4+ years) related experience</li><li>Demonstrated proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving skills</li><li>Excellent decision making and communication (written and oral) skills</li><li>Strong work ethic and the ability to work in an integrated product team (IPT) environment</li><li>Active or Current Top Secret Clearance is required to be considered</li><li>Must have the ability to obtain SCI level access</li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced knowledge and experience in antenna design</li><li>Familiarity with orbital mechanics, dynamics and controls, rendezvous and proximity operations (RPO), orbit determination, and attitude planning</li><li>Full life cycle experience developing, integrating, and deploying space systems</li><li>Working knowledge of DOORS</li><li>Recent experience in requirements allocation &amp; derivation, and verification traceability</li><li>Model Based Systems Engineering experience, especially in Cameo</li><li>Agile development experience, including use of Atlassian products</li><li>Ability and willing to travel</li><li>Active Top Secret Clearance with SCI and polygraph</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $120,000 USD - $180,000 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: The digital division of a stable enterprise that's known for innovation is hiring for an Apigee Software Engineer in their Chicago office. This is a modern, scalable and cloud-native enterprise team that's driving forward-thinking software. They're looking for someone with Apigee experience for this role. If you're interested in contributing to something exciting that will give you the opportunity to grow with a world call team, apply for more information! Contract Duration: 6 - 18 Months Required Skills &amp; Experience BS in Computer Science, or another related field 3+ years of professional software experience with an object-oriented programming language (Java, JavaScript, Python, etc.) Experience with Apigee Desired Skills &amp; Experience AWS experience preferred What You Will Be Doing Tech Breakdown 50% API design 50% Apigee Daily Responsibilities 75% Hands On 25% Team Collaboration<p><br></p>

title: Software Engineer-(RxR) Chicago-A
description: Medline Industries continues to grow, and grow, and grow. In fact, we've enjoyed DOUBLE DIGIT growth in 54 of the past 55 years! And we are AGAIN named as a Chicago Tribune Top Employer! Doesn't that sound like the kind of place you'd want to join?<p><br></p>Medline has an immediate opening for an experienced Java developer to join our software development team! This position will be responsible for designing and implementing solutions for various business initiatives. The ideal candidate is someone who is self-motivated, pleasant to collaborate with, and constantly seeking to improve and expand their skills.<p><br></p>In return, Medline offers a business casual, entrepreneurial work environment with strong growth potential.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Research, plan, design, code, test, deploy, and document high quality software </li><li>Troubleshoot and resolve software defects</li><li>Participate in code reviews</li><li>Adhere to established software development standards</li><li>Facilitate design meetings with users, management, and architects</li><li>Contribute to the continuous improvement of software development practices</li><li>Engage in continuous improvement of one’s own skill set, both technical and non-technical </li><li>Stay current on industry trends and best practices and promote their use as applicable</li><li>Develop a solid understanding of Medline’s business domain and apply this to all software development activities</li><li>Collaborate professionally with customers and colleagues</li><li>Comply with all company policies and procedures and governmental regulatory mandates</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>COVID-19 Vaccination</strong><p><br></p>Please be aware that Medline requires all employees starting in this position to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. This position will require the successful candidate to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated by their start date. Medline is an equal opportunity employer, and will provide reasonable accommodations to those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated for COVID-19 consistent with federal, state, and local l<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Java (minimum 4 years professionally)</li><li>Cloud and container-based development and deployment (Azure preferred)</li><li>Object oriented design principles and patterns</li><li>Spring framework</li><li>RESTful web service development</li><li>JUnit, Mockito, PowerMock</li><li>SQL</li><li>Git</li><li>Scrum</li></ul><p><br></p>The following experience is desirable, but not required:<p><br></p><ul><li>Docker, Kubernetes, Helm</li><li>Swagger/OpenAPI</li><li>SOAP, OData, GraphQL</li><li>OAuth 2.0, Ping Federate</li><li>HTTP protocol</li><li>JSON, XML</li><li>JEE (JSP, Servlet, EJB)</li><li>JPA, Hibernate, Spring Data</li><li>Splunk</li><li>HTML, CSS, JavaScript</li><li>UI Development frameworks (Angular, React, Bootstrap)</li><li>4 year degree in Computer Science or a related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Medline</strong><p><br></p><em>Medline Industries is the largest privately held manufacturer and distributor of healthcare supplies in the United States, providing more than 550,000 products that serve the entire continuum of care. Our innovative products and programs can be found in most hospitals, extended-care facilities, surgery centers, physician offices, home care dealers, home health agencies and retail outlets.</em><p><br></p><em>Founded in 1910, Medline has grown from a small manufacturer of aprons, surgical gowns and uniforms to a thriving $17 billion global enterprise because of our dedicated people, entrepreneurial spirit and honest values.</em><p><br></p><em>Again named one of the country’s "Best and Brightest Companies to Work For” and once again named to Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces, Medline has experienced fifty-plus years of consecutive annual growth, and is headquartered in Northfield, IL.</em><p><br></p><strong>Primary Location</strong><p><br></p>US-IL-LIBERTYVILLE<p><br></p><strong>Other Locations</strong><p><br></p>US-IL-CHICAGO, US-IL-Northbrook

Our innovative products and programs can be found in most hospitals, extended-care facilities, surgery centers, physician offices, home care dealers, home health agencies and retail outlets.</em><p><br></p><em>Founded in 1910, Medline has grown from a small manufacturer of aprons, surgical gowns and uniforms to a thriving $17 billion global enterprise because of our dedicated people, entrepreneurial spirit and honest values.</em><p><br></p><em>Again named one of the country’s "Best and Brightest Companies to Work For” and once again named to Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces, Medline has experienced fifty-plus years of consecutive annual growth, and is headquartered in Northfield, IL.</em><p><br></p><strong>Primary Location</strong><p><br></p>US-IL-LIBERTYVILLE<p><br></p><strong>Other Locations</strong><p><br></p>US-IL-CHICAGO, US-IL-Northbrook

title: Senior Fixed Income Operations Analyst
description: <strong>Job Summary:<br><br></strong>This role performs and implements activities that impacts components or processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens business software products OR Digital or Online application in an Agile environment. Work is typically received in short term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of defined procedures that provide desired functionality to digital solutions, products and programs, typically for intermediary, basic to complex systems. Implements activities that influence entry to mid level components of the functional area.<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Writes code that meets specifications. Develops software applications and tools. </li><li>Completes programming and performs testing and debugging applications</li><li>Develops software applications and tools using Java or React JS and Agile development methodologies. </li><li>Actively designs, architectures and builds phases utilizing Java or React JS to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. </li><li>Evaluates compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features. Develops professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. </li><li>Works on problems where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment to determine appropriate action. </li><li>Builds productive internal or external working relationships. </li><li>Demonstrates proficiency in several areas of the professional function. </li><li>Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization, including Java or React JS. </li><li>Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization. </li><li>Interacts with internal and external peers and or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities. </li><li>Acts as individual contributor as well as team member</li><li>Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. </li><li>Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. </li><li>Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. </li></ul><strong>About Walgreens and WBA<br><br></strong>Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar field and at least 2 years of professional work experience in Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field</li><li>Experience working with React Js and or Java</li><li>Proficient in back end languages, such as Java, Node or Typescript, Dot NET, Python etc with exposure to performance optimization of high traffic and scalable services</li><li>Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing and operations</li><li>Experience writing code for applications or automation</li><li>Experience with programming languages for online applications, microservices, apis or mobile applications</li><li>Experience building ,testing applications or automation</li><li>Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle</li><li>Experience creating coding solutions to fix moderate problems or issue</li><li>Willing to travel up to or at least 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Experience with full stack development ranging from front end user interfaces to back end systems</li><li>Hands on with modern ui frameworks like React with good knowledge of front end design pattern (stateless components, conditional rendering, controlled components, hooks etc.)</li><li>Excellent knowledge of distributed SQL (example, Oracle, MySQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra) design and consumption patterns</li><li>Experience with implementation, capacity planning and performance tuning of Cloud technologies Azure (ACS, AKS), Google, IBM, AWS or Cloud Foundry</li><li>Experience in a retail digital ecommerce space</li></ul>

To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar field and at least 2 years of professional work experience in Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field</li><li>Experience working with React Js and or Java</li><li>Proficient in back end languages, such as Java, Node or Typescript, Dot NET, Python etc with exposure to performance optimization of high traffic and scalable services</li><li>Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing and operations</li><li>Experience writing code for applications or automation</li><li>Experience with programming languages for online applications, microservices, apis or mobile applications</li><li>Experience building ,testing applications or automation</li><li>Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle</li><li>Experience creating coding solutions to fix moderate problems or issue</li><li>Willing to travel up to or at least 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Experience with full stack development ranging from front end user interfaces to back end systems</li><li>Hands on with modern ui frameworks like React with good knowledge of front end design pattern (stateless components, conditional rendering, controlled components, hooks etc.)</li><li>Excellent knowledge of distributed SQL (example, Oracle, MySQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra) design and consumption patterns</li><li>Experience with implementation, capacity planning and performance tuning of Cloud technologies Azure (ACS, AKS), Google, IBM, AWS or Cloud Foundry</li><li>Experience in a retail digital ecommerce space</li></ul>

title: React Native Mobile Developer - Hybrid
description: Aha! helps companies build lovable software. We provide the world's #1 product development tools — Aha! Roadmaps , Aha! Ideas , Aha! Create , and Aha! Develop — which are used by more than 700,000 builders. Product teams rely on our expertise, guided templates, and training programs via Aha! Academy to be their best. We are proud to be a very different type of high-growth SaaS company. The business is self-funded, profitable, and 100 percent remote. We are recognized as one of the best fully remote companies to work for, champion the Bootstrap Movement , and have given over $1M to people in need through Aha! Cares . Learn more at www.aha.io .<p><br></p><strong>Our team</strong><p><br></p>Aha! engineering is a mid-sized, fully remote team that is highly productive. We are centered around North American time zones so we can collaborate during the workday.<p><br></p><ul><li>We help each other grow: We each bring unique skills to the table and want our teammates to feel valued from the start. Our onboarding program exposes new hires to the codebase and lets them contribute right away. </li><li>We move quickly: We ship code multiple times a day. We believe in getting valuable features in front of customers and iteratively improving as we learn what works and what does not. </li><li>We value product over process: We want the team to have the time and focus on solving complex challenges. We minimize the overhead by setting clear goals and avoiding heavyweight processes and excessive meetings.</li><li>We share knowledge freely: We share our learnings with each other and with the developer community. Our engineering blog demonstrates how we tackle interesting challenges at Aha! </li><li>We enjoy: We like what we do. And we want you to love your team and your job too. Learn more about The Responsive Method , our company values , and the generous benefits we offer.</li></ul><strong>Our technology</strong><p><br></p>Our web application is a single-instance, multi-tenant Ruby on Rails monolith supported by Postgres (database), Redis (background jobs), and memcached (Rails caching). We also run a Node.js webserver to support collaborative editing and real-time updates. Our application is hosted on Amazon Web Services and architected with ECS for reproducibility and scalability.<p><br></p>We utilize a growing amount of React on the front end to build rich client-side experiences, including our fully collaborative text editor and our slide presentation editor. We balance the strengths of both technologies — Rails for its conventions and simplicity and React for more powerful interactive functionality.<p><br></p>We embrace new technologies that help us deliver a lovable product, but we also remain cognizant of the maintenance overhead that a new library or platform brings. We solve the problems in front of us rather than prematurely optimizing to address issues that may never materialize.<p><br></p>We do most of our planning and collaboration in Aha! Roadmaps and built Aha! Develop so that software engineers and their teams could take advantage of those same rich features. We use Slack and Zoom for video calls. (Email? Rarely.)<p><br></p><strong><u>Your Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>Most of our features involve writing significant Ruby on Rails code, so you should have experience working in a Rails codebase. We also write a lot of React but we are happy to help you learn that part on the job.<p><br></p><strong><u>You Also Have The Below Experience And Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>We believe that being a kind person who elevates the rest of the team is just as valuable as writing great code. You have strong problem-solving skills and experience working on important functionality for a cloud-based product. You are humble, eager to learn, and always willing to help others. You want teammates who enjoy solving problems regardless of the technologies and techniques involved. You have worked at meaningful scale before and want to do so again.<p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of experience working in Ruby on Rails</li><li>Experience producing scalable, efficient, and maintainable code</li><li>Experience building features (ideally at a high-growth SaaS company)</li><li>Active collaborator with product teams</li></ul><strong>Your work at Aha!</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>As a Ruby On Rails Engineer, Your Work Will Include</u></strong><p><br></p>We work on a broad range of features across the full stack.<p><br></p><ul><li>Implementing new features for our users, touching each layer of the MVC as needed</li><li>Building deeply interactive reporting interfaces using React</li><li>Working proactively with product and UX to refine and iterate on specifications as the feature takes shape</li><li>Investigating slow performance and optimizing queries to ensure Aha! is snappy and satisfying to use</li><li>Interfacing directly with users to quickly squash bugs as part of our regular customer support rotation </li><li>Documenting components in our style guide to help drive consistency</li></ul><p><br></p>If this role sounds appealing, we would love to hear from you. (A real human reviews every application.)<p><br></p><strong>Grow with us</strong><p><br></p>Everyone deserves to reach their fullest potential. We know that when we do work that matters with people we care about in a high-growth environment, we feel engaged and alive. And our goal is to help you do just that. We offer all the benefits you would expect and more, including profit sharing. The specific benefits listed below are reflective of what we offer U.S.-based hires. We also do our best to extend identical benefits to international teammates.<p><br></p><ul><li>The base salary range for this role in the US is between $100,000 and $160,000</li><li>Cash-based compensation also includes profit sharing and we contribute a percentage of your total pay each month towards your retirement</li><li>Medical, dental, and vision plans — for many teammates, we cover 100 percent of the premiums</li><li>Up to 200 hours of paid time off a year to spend however you want</li><li>30 to 90 days of paid parental leave and five to 10 days of paid care and bereavement leave</li><li>Up to $1,000 annually for third-party education, along with paid time off to immerse yourself in learning</li><li>Volunteer opportunities throughout the year</li></ul><p><br></p>Base salary and total compensation are dependent upon many factors, such as: skills, experience, and relevant past roles
