fundamental</li><li> Should be independently able to design, solution and engineering</li><li> Should have data modelling and analytical skills</li><li> Should be well versed in managing product scalability and performance</li><li> Cloud migration knowledge is desirable</li><li> Should have very good communication skills</li><li> Should have very good communication skill and should be able to assess and analyze work with client independently</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Roles/Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Design and implement effective API based solutions and models with by using Spring boot and Java.</li><li> Examine and identify existing system structural necessities by evaluating business requirements.</li><li> Assess Web/API implementation procedures to ensure they comply with internal and external regulations.</li><li> Prepare accurate system design and architecture reports for management and executive teams.</li><li> Oversee the migration of application from legacy systems to new solutions.</li><li> Monitor the system performance by performing regular tests, troubleshooting, and integrating new features.</li><li> Recommend solutions to improve new and existing API solutions.</li><li> Educate staff members through training and individual support.</li><li> Offer support by responding to system problems in a timely manner.</li><li> Understand and document data flows in and between different systems/applications</li><li> Guidance to developers in preparing functional/technical specs to define developing requirement and process.</li></ul><p><br></p><em> Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.</em>

title: Space TS/SCI - Sr. Principal Systems Engineer - Integration & Test (Up to $15K in sign-on bonus!)
description: Are you looking for a hybrid or remote work opportunity? Are you interested in a workplace that allows for flexibility in your day? Are you ready for a workplace that provides benefits that suit your needs?<p><br></p>This Senior Software Engineer will join Relativity's Cloud Engineering department and be responsible for optimizing an enterprise-sized unstructured data storage platform. This includes multiple critical path services and libraries storing dozens of petabytes of data and handling billions of operations monthly. This Senior Software Engineer will work with Advanced, Senior, Lead, Staff, and Principal members of the engineering team and business stakeholders to support the development of products, features and services that drive and evolve our SaaS offering.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Implementing tools and technologies to provision and configure an enterprise software system in public and sovereign clouds with a focus on increasing efficiency and elasticity of deployed compute without sacrificing quality  </li><li>Ability to contribute throughout all phases of a service lifecycle from conception through design, development, deployment, and ultimately operation </li><li>Ability to contribute to and mature existing, automated CICD workflows </li><li>A commitment to monitoring and observability </li><li>Identify, document, automate, and engineer processes for repeated tasks  </li><li>Oversee the application environment to effectively run and maintain the technology and determine the advisement of potential technology or process improvements  </li><li>Strategize, plan, prioritize, schedule, and partner in the execution of infrastructure provisioning and configuration while focusing on maintaining or improving security, data integrity, programming logic integrity, and administration  </li><li>Manage the deployment of our infrastructure product and our deployment/upgrade processes </li><li>Seek and recommend improvements to current processes and technologies used  </li><li>Participate in code reviews for projects written by your team  </li><li>Participate in design reviews for new and existing services and platforms  </li><li>Influence the use of industry-leading development platforms and process </li><li>Participate in the on-call rotation to support our customers’ experience </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar technical degree, or work equivalent experience  </li><li>Experience with software engineering best practices: unit testing, code reviews, design documentation, excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills  </li><li>4+ years of software development of commercial-grade systems and applications </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with infrastructure and distributed systems in a cloud environment (Azure preferred)  </li><li>Experience with .NET and C# development </li><li>Experience with Linux, FUSE development </li><li>Experience developing or managing file systems and storage services </li><li>Excellent communication &amp; enthusiasm  </li><li>Experience working on an Agile development team </li><li>Experience reviewing code </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Relativity is committed to competitive, fair and equitable compensation practices.</li><li>This position is eligible for total compensation which includes a competitive base salary, annual performance bonus target of 10%, and long-term incentives. The expected salary range for this role is between $112,000 and $152,000. The final offered salary will be based on several factors, including but not limited to the candidate’s depth of experience, skill set, qualifications, and internal pay equity. Hiring at the top end of the range would not be typical, to allow for future meaningful salary growth in this position.</li></ul><p><br></p>Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefit Highlights</u></strong><p><br></p>Comprehensive health, dental, and vision plans<p><br></p>Parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers<p><br></p>Flexible work arrangements<p><br></p>Two, week-long company breaks per year<p><br></p>Unlimited time off<p><br></p>Long-term incentive program<p><br></p>Training investment program<p><br></p><strong>Transparency in Coverage Information</strong><p><br></p>The Transparency in Coverage Final Rule requires disclosure of the negotiated rates with in-network providers and the historic allowed amounts paid to out-of-network providers, for all health plans available to employers. Files containing this information for the plans covered are published on this page.<p><br></p><strong>Link: </strong> https://www.bcbsil.com/asomrf?EIN=123456789<p><br></p><em>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.</em>

title: Associate Quality Assurance Policy and Strategy Analyst
description: Position Title: .NET Web Application Developer Duration: LONG TERM Location: Chicago, ILDynamic Interactive Business System Inc. is looking for a .NET Web Application Developer for its direct Client in Chicago, IL. The developer will work onsite/remote at the Client headquarters performing project-based tasks as assigned.Responsibilities:Support the Information Technology department’s activities to ensure completion and maintenance of the Client's ASP.NET Web Applications, including but not limited to: Waitlist Portals, Section 3 Portals, HCV QA/QC Tracking and Reasonable Accommodation Portals.Develop new ASP.NET Web Applications and/or re-engineer the existing ASP.NET Web Applications.Engineer high level requirements to derive system and architecture specifications, functional specifications, detailed design specifications and feasibility prototypes.Conduct and participate in code reviews of either Client's developed or vendor-supplied applications.Develop test scripts to ensure the quality of applications.Support data model development interoperability of the various ASP.Net Web Applications.Collaborate with project teams and key stakeholders to assess the needs of “buy-or-build” systems.Participate in project meetings to communicate architecture concepts across various projects and provide applicable architecture development status.Identify risks and provide recommendations to mitigate and/or eliminate risk.Interface with development teams and contribute in a fast paced, integrated team environment.Education and Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent work experience.Solid Knowledge of object-oriented design and development on a Microsoft .NET platform.Solid Knowledge of the methodology of Agile Development.A minimum of five (5) years of development experience in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, C#, ASP.NET and MVC with MS Visual Studio.Demonstrated experience in developing three tier applications based on the .NET platform.Demonstrated experience with IIS web applications.Ability to effectively test/certify developed mobile applications.Understanding of Microsoft Active Directory (AD) and AD Security.Ability to diagnose and correct performance problems.Understanding of and experience with SharePoint (2013/2016) is preferred.Ability to customize SharePoint portal layout, implement features, create dynamic workflows, develop web parts and generate reports with SharePoint Reporting Server is preferred.Self-motivated and focused, with a positive outlook and excellent organizational skills.Experience working within an Agile project framework in team-oriented environment.Excellent oral and written communication skills. Effective interpersonal skills, ability to maintain good working relationships.Ability to make decisions according to rules, regulations, and procedures.Ability to understand and carry out complex instructions, prepare and maintain complex records and files.Discretion in handling confidential/sensitive information. .NET Developer - $30/hr

title: Apigee Software Engineer
description: Cerebra Consulting Inc is a System Integrator and IT Services Solution provider with a focus on Big Data, Business Analytics, Cloud Solutions, Amazon Web Services, Salesforce, Oracle EBS, Peoplesoft, Hyperion, Oracle Configurator, Oracle CPQ, Oracle PLM and Custom Application Development. Utilizing solid business experience, industry-specific expertise, and proven methodologies, we consistently deliver measurable results for our customers. Cerebra has partnered with leading enterprise software companies and cloud providers such as Oracle, Salesforce, Amazon and able to leverage these partner relationships to deliver high-quality, end-to-end customer solutions that are targeted to the needs of each customer. Java Kafka Developer Location: Hybrid (Chicago IL ,3 Days onsite) Duration: 7 Months What you need to succeed: At least 9+ years' experience in building highly scalable, high performance, and highly available back-end applications. Kafka streaming experience Experience with event driven framework Strong Mongo DB skills and experience Development expertise in REST/SOAP/JSON API. Solid working knowledge of NoSQL (e.g., Elasticsearch + Time Series Databases). Unix background with RedHat Spring Cloud Stream preference skill Payment's domain or financial industry experience Experience with large volumes of data Solid understanding of algorithm complexity, parallel/distributed systems, advanced data structures, computer networking, and operating systems. Prior experience working with Agile/Scrum methodologies. Start-up environment experience will be a plus, although not mandatory. Strength in backend service development Self-initiating developer Takes ownership and is reliable Thanks Sai Revanth Email - Phone|
